marene: <entryFree id="n28021" type="hapax" key="Mare_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region of Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marga: <entryFree id="n28022" type="main" key="marga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of earth, marl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 6, 4, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
margania: <entryFree id="n28023" type="main" key="Marga_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Margānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Margiana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 15</bibl> Foss. (al. Margianam).</sense></entryFree>
margarides: <entryFree id="n28024" type="greek" key="marga^ri^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margărĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">margari/des</foreign>, <sense id="n28024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round kind of date</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the Maldive nut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
margarita: <entryFree id="n28025" type="greek" key="marga^ri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margărīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">margărī-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">margari/ths</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">li/qos</foreign>), <sense id="n28025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pearl</hi>, </sense><sense id="n28025.1" n="a" level="4"> Form margarita (class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 213, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nego ullam gemmam fuisse, aut margaritam, quin abstulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus margaritarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea margaritarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 53, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una pretiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 46</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: ne mittatis margaritas vestras ante porcos,</quote> <trans><tr>do not cast your pearls before swine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28025.2" n="b" level="4"> Form margaritum (rare, not in Cic.): arma margarito candicantia, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 213, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gignit et Oceanus margarita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:17:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 17, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Ux. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Pall. 5</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 648; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psych. 873</bibl>.—As a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">pearl, treasure</hi>: Tiberinum margaritum, said of <hi rend="ital">Mæcenas</hi>, Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
margaritarius: <entryFree id="n28026" type="main" key="marga^ri_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margărītārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>margarita</etym>, <sense id="n28026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pearls, pearl-</hi> (postclass.): porticus, <hi rend="ital">where pearls were bought</hi>, Auct. de Region. Urb. Rom. Reg. 8.—</sense><sense id="n28026.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28026.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">margărītārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in pearls, a pearl-fisher</hi>, Firm. Math. 4, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1602</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4076</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4218</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28026.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Margărītārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female dealer in pearls</hi>, Inscr Orell. 4148.</sense></entryFree>
margaritatus: <entryFree id="n28027" type="main" key="marga^ri_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margărītātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>margarita</etym>, <sense id="n28027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with pearls</hi> (post-class.): sinus, Ven. Carm. 8, 6, 266 (where the metre requires margārītatus).</sense></entryFree>
margaritifer: <entryFree id="n28028" type="hapax" key="marga^ri_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margărītĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>margarita-fero</etym>, <sense id="n28028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pearl-bearing, containing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">producing pearls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
margarition: <entryFree id="n28029" type="main" key="marga^ri_ti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margărītĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>margaritum</etym>, <sense id="n28029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pearl;</hi> transf., of a beloved child, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2681</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
margaritum: <entryFree id="n28030" type="main" key="marga^ri_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margărītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. margarita.</entryFree>
margella: <entryFree id="n28031" type="gloss" key="margella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margella</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">kora/llion</foreign> (<sense id="n28031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red coral</hi>), Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
margiana: <entryFree id="n28032" type="main" key="Margi^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Margĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Margĭānē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*margianh/</foreign>, <sense id="n28032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Asia, beyond the Caspian Sea, between Bactria and Hyrcania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 15</bibl> Mütz. (dub. al. Marganiam).</sense></entryFree>
margino: <entryFree id="n28033" type="main" key="margi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>margo</etym>, <sense id="n28033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish with a border, to border, enclose with a margin</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">viae marginandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae marginatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga limbis marginata puniceis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
margis: <entryFree id="n28034" type="main" key="Margis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Margis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Margas</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Mœsia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
margo: <entryFree id="n28035" type="main" key="margo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">margo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 684</bibl> P.), <sense id="n28035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an edge, brink, border, margin</hi> (class., but not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">flumen marginibus lapideis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 61, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margine gramineo (sc. fontis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:598" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <trans><tr>a boundary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:360" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <trans><tr>shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridi si margine cluderet undas herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>: capite super margine scuti posito, <cb n="MARI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">margo, quae sustinet arenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>; Aemil. Macer. and Rabir. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 49</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">plena jam margine libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">margine in extremo littera rasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <trans><tr>threshold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:54" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>boundary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:199" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 199</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo in margine imperii, qua Rhenus alluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 20, 43, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28035.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">partem modicae sumptam de margine cenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the side-dishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
margum: <entryFree id="n28036" type="hapax" key="Margum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Margum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Upper Mœsia, on the Margis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maria: <entryFree id="n28037" type="main" key="Ma^ri_^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28037.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mary, the mother of Jesus</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marĭa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apoth. 643</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Car. Pasch. 2, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marīa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hymn. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28037.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mary Magdalene</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28037.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mary of Bethany, sister of Lazarus and Martha</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28038" type="main" key="Ma^ri_^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărī^a</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Parthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 29, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mariambulus: <entryFree id="n28039" type="main" key="ma^ri^ambu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărĭambŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mareambulo</etym>, <sense id="n28039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a walker on the sea</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Petrum non funambulum, sed ut ita dicam mariambulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 39:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 39, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mariana: <entryFree id="n28040" type="main" key="Ma^ri^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Marius, B.</entryFree>
mariandyni: <entryFree id="n28041" type="main" key="Ma^ri^andy_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭandȳni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mariandunoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n28041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:2" default="NO">2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:171" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 171</bibl>; Avien. Descr. Orbis, 960; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 924</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭ-andȳnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Mariandyni, Mariandynian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:733" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 733</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marianus: <entryFree id="n28042" type="main" key="Ma^ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Marius, B.</entryFree>
marica: <entryFree id="n28043" type="main" key="Ma^ri_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph in the territory of Minturnæ, on the river Liris, the fabled mother of the Latins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 47</bibl>; Serv. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 23</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">Circe, who was deified after her death</hi>. After her was named the lucus Maricae, <hi rend="ital">the grove consecrated to her</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, silva Maricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:83:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 83, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, querceta Maricae, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 259: palus Maricae,</quote> <trans><tr>the lake near Minturnæ, where Marius hid himself after his flight from Sylla</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Minlurnæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna Maricae,</quote> <trans><tr>the territory of Minturnæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 424</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maricas: <entryFree id="n28044" type="main" key="Maricas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maricas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*marika=s</foreign>, <sense id="n28044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a title of a comedy of Eupolis, directed against Hyperbolus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 18</bibl> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
mariccus: <entryFree id="n28045" type="main" key="Mariccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mariccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Boian, who stirred up a revolt against Vitellius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marinus: <entryFree id="n28046" type="main" key="ma^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mare</etym>, <sense id="n28046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sea, sea-, marine</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">marini terrenique umores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: mustela, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduphag. p. 166 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-born</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <trans><tr>rosemary</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituli,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-calves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:238" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus,</quote> <trans><tr>of sea-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 191</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrenum differt a marino,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that which is produced by the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marisca: <entryFree id="n28047" type="main" key="ma^risca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large inferior kind of fig</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues mariscae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:415" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:25:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 25, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in apposition with ficus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8</bibl></cit> (also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 72</bibl>); so, mariscae fici, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 550, 31</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n28047.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the piles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidae mariscae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mariscos: <entryFree id="n28048" type="main" key="ma^riscos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măriscos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de junco, quem mariscon appellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marita: <entryFree id="n28049" type="main" key="ma^ri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n28049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a married woman, wife</hi>, v. 1. maritus, III.</sense></entryFree>
maritalis: <entryFree id="n28050" type="main" key="ma^ri_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. maritus</etym>, <sense id="n28050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to married people, matrimonial, nuptial, conjugal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> 1: <cit><quote lang="la">fax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:ib. 6:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capistrum,</quote> <trans><tr>the marriagehalter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 43</bibl></cit>: honor et affectio, Fragm. Jur. Rom. Vat. 253 a, Huschke.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., matrimonially</hi>, Aug. in Johann. tr. 31, 3.</sense></entryFree>
maritatus: <entryFree id="n28051" type="main" key="ma^ri_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. and P. a.</hi> of marito.</sense></entryFree>
maritimus: <entryFree id="n28052" type="main" key="ma^ri^ti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărĭtĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mărĭtŭmus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mare</etym>, <sense id="n28052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sea, sea-</hi>, <cb n="MARI" /> <hi rend="ital">maritime</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28052.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus movi maritumos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines maritimi,</quote> <trans><tr>seamen, mariners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e barbaris ipsis nulli erant antea maritimi praeter Etruscos et Poenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimus et navalis hostis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci maritimi, an remoti a mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>on the seacoast, lying on the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <trans><tr>a voyage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>maritime affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-going</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecfugere a vita marituma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>with the pirates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus, navibus ab maritima vi tutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-salt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>on the sea-coast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18, 33</bibl></cit>: nuptiae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">those of Peleus with Thetis</hi> (opp. terrenae nuptiae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with Musa</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurae,</quote> <trans><tr>from maritime speculations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mărĭtĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">maritime parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maritimis sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritima Aetoliae vastare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritima Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarraconis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n28052.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">changeable, inconstant</hi>, like the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marito: <entryFree id="n28053" type="main" key="ma^ri_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. maritus</etym>, <sense id="n28053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give a husband</hi> to one; hence <hi rend="ital">to wed, marry, give in marriage</hi> to a man. </sense><sense id="n28053.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellii filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex (Augusti) de maritandis ordinibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>imposing fines for celibacy in all classes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Julia de maritandis ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:178" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 11, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">pleonastically: matrimonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to conclude, make</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">absol., to marry, take a wife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritandum principem suaderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28053.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28053.3" n="A" level="2"> Of animals and plants. </sense><sense id="n28053.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: maritari, <hi rend="ital">to be coupled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have a mate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc dicuntur catulire, id est ostendere, se velle maritari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28053.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To impregnate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Zephyrus) glebas fecundo rore maritat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 89</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">pass., to be impregnated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (feminae) ternae singulis (maribus) maritantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28053.6" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to wed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to tie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi> to another tree: <cit><quote lang="la">adultā vitium propagine Altas maritat populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmi vitibus maritantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:79" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:1" default="NO">4, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritandae arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a wife</hi>.—Comic.: <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Pulchra dos pecunia est. <hi rend="ital">P.</hi> Quae quidem non maritata est, <hi rend="ital">yes, if not accompanied with a wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wife, a married woman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, opp. virgines, viduae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 77</bibl>, n. 12.</sense></entryFree>
maritus: <entryFree id="n28054" type="main" key="ma^ri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mas</etym>, <sense id="n28054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to marriage, matrimonial, conjugal, nuptial, marriage-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28054.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n28054.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facibus cessit maritis,</quote> <trans><tr>to the nuptial torches, to wedlock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <trans><tr>the conjugal tie</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 26</bibl></cit> (4, 20, 16); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <trans><tr>wedded love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:16:283" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 283</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <trans><tr>conjugal fidelity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 11: lex, <hi rend="ital">respecting marriage, a marriage-law</hi> (de maritandis ordinibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 20</bibl>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">vagabatur per maritas domos dies noctesque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the houses of married people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31, 5</bibl></cit> Drak.—</sense><sense id="n28054.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28054.4" n="1" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">wedded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tied up</hi> (cf. marito, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 32, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:32" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmo conjuncta marito (sc. vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28054.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impregnating, fertilizing</hi> (in postclass. poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus (Nili),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 339</bibl></cit>: imbres, Pervigil. Ven. 4, 11.—</sense><sense id="n28054.6" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28054.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a married man, husband</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">conjux, vir): ditis damnosos maritos sub basilica quaerito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut maritus sis quam optimae (mulieris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:4" default="NO">3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl>; Val Max. 8, 2, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 17</bibl> et saep.: insidian <pb n="1115" /> <cb n="MARM" /> iem somno maritorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae major calumnia est quam venire imberbum adulescentem, bene valentem ac maritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. coelebs: seu maritum sive coelibem scortarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus optandusque maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:211" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus ingratusque maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mariti testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygio servire marito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unico gaudens mulier marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus,</quote> <trans><tr>a newly-married man, a young husband</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra quartum et vicesimum annum maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut juveni primum virgo deducta marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Bithynorum, si quid mulier contrahat, maritum auctorem esse jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:193" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si maritus pro muliere se obligaverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus lugendus decem mensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28054.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28054.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lover, suitor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21</bibl> (3, 14), 10: <cit><quote lang="la">aegram (Dido) nulli quondam flexere mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28054.10" n="2" level="3"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">ol ens maritus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a he-goat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem pecori dixere maritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 125</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gregum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of cocks,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28054.11" n="3" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mă-rīti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">married people, man and wife</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi mariti,</quote> <trans><tr>newly-married people, a young couple</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 201, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28054.12" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mărīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a married woman, wife</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">marita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castae maritae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:139" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 175</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2665</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 299 al.</bibl>; and freq. on epitaphs.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28055" type="main" key="ma^ri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. maritus, II. A.</entryFree>
marium: <entryFree id="n28056" type="main" key="Marium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mareum</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma:rion</foreign>, <sense id="n28056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of Cyprus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marius: <entryFree id="n28057" type="main" key="Ma^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n28057.1" n="1" level="3"> The most celebrated is C. Marius, <hi rend="ital">the conqueror of Jugurtha, and seven times consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 46</bibl> sqq.; as a friend of the popular party, his name is used as an appellative: Caesari multos Marios inesse, <hi rend="ital">Cæsar had many Mariuses in him</hi>, Sulla ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n28057.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Marius Gratidianus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:168" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 45, 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 3, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 46, § 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28057.3" n="3" level="3"> Marius Priscus, <hi rend="ital">proconsul in Africa, tried for extortion</hi>, A. D. 100, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:120" default="NO">8, 120</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28057.4" n="4" level="3"> Marius Victorinus, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician and grammarian, a native of Africa, in the middle of the fourth century of the Christian era</hi>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n28057.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to C. Marius, Marian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 17, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28057.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to C. Marius, Marian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mariani consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:175" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 47, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum Cimbricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mariana et Sullana tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mariana et Cinnana rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman colony on the eastern coast of Corsica, founded by C. Marius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĭ-āni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">another name of the Cernetari in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marmaricus: <entryFree id="n28058" type="main" key="Marma^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marmărĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*marmariko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Marmarica</hi> (a country lying between Egypt and the Syrtes, now Barca), <hi rend="ital">Marmaric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus capparis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 44, § 127</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (postAug.), <hi rend="ital">African</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 293</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the swarm of Carthaginians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:83" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the elephant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marmarides: <entryFree id="n28059" type="main" key="Marma^ri^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marmărĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*marmari/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n28059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man from Marmarica</hi> (v. Marmaricus), <hi rend="ital">a Marmarican</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspide Marmaridae Corythi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 124</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Marmăridae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Marmarica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marmaridae Psylli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 894</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalanx Marmaridūm,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Carthaginians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:184" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marmaritis: <entryFree id="n28060" type="greek" key="marma^ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmărītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">marmari=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n28060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that grows in marble quarries</hi>, = aglaophotis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marmaryga: <entryFree id="n28061" type="main" key="marma^ry^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmăryga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">marmarugh/</foreign>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">marmărygma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">marma/</foreign><foreign lang="greek">rugma</foreign>,<cb n="MARM" />  <sense id="n28061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">movable specks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spots in the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:62" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:2:52" default="NO">1, 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marmessus: <entryFree id="n28062" type="hapax" key="Marmessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marmessus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marmissus (-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Troas, on Mount Ida</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marmor: <entryFree id="n28063" type="greek" key="marmor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">marmur</orth>; <number>plur.</number> marmura, Antonius Gripho ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> marmori, Corp. Inscr. L. 1012; <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 14</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root mar-, gleam, glimmer (v. mare), the white or gleaming stone; cf. margarita, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/rmaros</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n28063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marble</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28063.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni marmore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parium marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:30" default="NO">5, 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu secanda marmora Locas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum de marmore ponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivos ducent de marmore vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 848</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes crusta marmoris operire totius domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">A MARMORIBVS,</quote> <trans><tr>one whose office it was to superintend the purchasing and working of marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 593, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmora,</quote> <trans><tr>kinds of marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:126" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 16, 25, § 126</bibl>; but <hi rend="ital">blocks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pieces of marble</hi>, Hor. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:22:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 22, 8</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>.—</sense><sense id="n28063.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28063.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pulverized marble, marble-dust</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:45" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 24, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28063.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A marble</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n28063.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A piece of wrought marble, marble statue</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Praxiteles marmore nobilitatus est Gnidiaque Venere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 38, 39, § 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 234</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 487</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo marmora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:790" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 790</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas marmora manant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 312</bibl></cit>; so <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 1, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:40" default="NO">14, 40</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n28063.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A building of marble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:63:1" default="NO">10, 63, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28063.7" n="3" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">plur., a marble pavement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:2:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:60:12" default="NO">12, 60, 12</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 360</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:430" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 430</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28063.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mile-stone</hi> of marble: <cit><quote lang="la">rus marmore tertio notatum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>three miles from town</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:31:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 31, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28063.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A marble slab</hi> upon a sideboard, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:205" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28063.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hard, stony tumor in the joints of the horse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque in genibus aut phlegmon oritur, aut marmora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumor obduratione convertitur in marmor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 48, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28063.11" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Stone</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 404</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen inducit marmora rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>incrusts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 314</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28063.12" n="G" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the bright level surface of the sea;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the surface of the sea, the sea</hi> in gen.: verrunt extemplo placide mare marmore flavo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 21</bibl> (Ann. v. 377 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 767</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lento luctantur marmore tonsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 254</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libycum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumant vada marmore verso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmora pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:464" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium,</quote> <trans><tr>the surface of a lake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:568" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 568</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marmorarius: <entryFree id="n28064" type="main" key="marmo^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>marmor</etym>, <sense id="n28064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to marble, marble</hi>. (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">faber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mar-mŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a worker in marble, marble-mason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:90:13" default="NO">90, 13</bibl>; Firm. Math. 8, 19.</sense></entryFree>
marmoratio: <entryFree id="n28065" type="main" key="marmo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>marmoro</etym>, <sense id="n28065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overlaying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incrusting with marble</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 359, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marmoratum: <entryFree id="n28066" type="main" key="marmo^ra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmŏrātum</orth>, v. marmoro <sense id="n28066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
marmoreus: <entryFree id="n28067" type="main" key="marmo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>marmor</etym>, <sense id="n28067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consisting of marble, marble-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28067.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">signum aëneum, marmoreum, eburneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <trans><tr>a floor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: facere aliquem marmoreum, <hi rend="ital">to make of marble</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">as a marble statue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere aliquem marmoreum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colossus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:230" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28067.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28067.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to marble, marble-</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28067.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Resembling marble</hi> (in whiteness or smoothness), <hi rend="ital">marble-like, marble-</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): pectus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 391, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:481" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 56, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candor,</quote> <trans><tr>marblewhiteness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>whiteness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 775</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paros (from its famous marble quarries),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4</bibl></cit>. 918: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 729</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28067.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adorned with statues</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucanus in hortis marmoreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marmoro: <entryFree id="n28068" type="main" key="marmo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overlay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incrust with marble</hi> (post-Aug.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): palatio exornato <cb n="MARR" /> hoc genere marmorandi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus marmorata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti plaga marmorata dorso,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>paved with stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:96" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28068.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make a kind of plaster out of marble</hi> (ante-class., and only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">tectorium marmoratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mar-mŏrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a covering for walls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">floors made of pounded marble and lime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:7:3" default="NO">3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marmorosus: <entryFree id="n28069" type="main" key="marmo^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>marmor</etym>, <sense id="n28069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like marble, hard as marble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sil marmorosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 56, § 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 20, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marmusculum: <entryFree id="n28070" type="main" key="marmuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marmuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small work in marble</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 27, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marnas: <entryFree id="n28071" type="main" key="Marnas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marnas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Syrian</etym>, <sense id="n28071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity worshipped at Gaza, in Palestine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Isa. 7, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Hilar. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maro: <entryFree id="n28072" type="main" key="Ma^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from root smar-, to be thoughtful; cf. memor</etym>, <sense id="n28072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the family name of the poet</hi> P. Vergilius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 15, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium sacri miraris abesse Maronis: Sint Maecenates, non deerunt, Flacce, Marones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altisonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 180</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a statue of Virgil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 227</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28072.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mă-rōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the poet Virgil, Maronian, Virgilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28072.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărōnĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Maronian, Virgilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28073" type="main" key="Ma^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Sicily, near the river Himera</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl> (dub.; Jan., ad Maroneum et Gemellos colles).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28074" type="main" key="Ma^ro3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma)rwn</foreign>, <sense id="n28074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the companion and instructor of the youthful Bacchus</hi>: terra Thraeca, ubi Liberi fanum inclutum Maro locavit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 14</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 170 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28074.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:30:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 30, 14</bibl> (al. leg. Anione), as the name of <hi rend="ital">a statue beside a spring</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">a Silenus</hi> (v. Herzb. Com. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 14</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
maroboduus: <entryFree id="n28075" type="main" key="Maro^bo^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marŏbŏdŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Marbod, king of the Suevi, who, being defeated by Arminius and compelled to flee, was hospitably received by Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maron: <entryFree id="n28076" type="main" key="maron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maron</orth>, v. marum.</entryFree>
maronea: <entryFree id="n28077" type="main" key="Ma^ro_ne_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărōnēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărōnīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*marw/neia</foreign>. <sense id="n28077.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Thrace, on the Schœneus, famous for its wine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Marona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:60:7" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 60, 7</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Maronea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:57" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28077.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of the Samnites</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Campo Marano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maroneus: <entryFree id="n28078" type="main" key="Maro_ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marōnēus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n28078.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Virgil;</hi> v. Maro, I. A.—</sense><sense id="n28078.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town of Maronea;</hi> v. Maronea, I.</sense></entryFree>
maronianus: <entryFree id="n28079" type="main" key="Ma^ro_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Maro, II. B.</entryFree>
maronion: <entryFree id="n28080" type="hapax" key="maroni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maronĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> Centaurea major, <hi rend="ital">the greater centaury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marpessius: <entryFree id="n28081" type="main" key="Marpessi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marpessĭus</orth>, v. 1. Marpessus.</entryFree>
marpessus: <entryFree id="n28082" type="main" key="Marpessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marpessus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marpēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/rphssos</foreign> (another form of <foreign lang="greek">*ma/rmhssos</foreign> v. Marmessus), <sense id="n28082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the Troas, on Mount Ida, home of the Erythrean Sibyl</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marpessĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ēsius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Marpessus in the Troas, Marpessian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 67</bibl> Drisen.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28083" type="main" key="Marpessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marpessus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Marpēsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/rphssos</foreign>, <sense id="n28083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in the island of Paros, in which lay the quarries of Parian marble</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg.
