A. 6, 471</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marpessĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Marpēsĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Marpessus</hi> in Paros, <hi rend="ital">Marpessian;</hi> and transf., <hi rend="ital">Parian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marpessia cautes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Parian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 471</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and referring to the above passage, Marpessia rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marra: <entryFree id="n28084" type="main" key="marra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. unknown</etym>, <sense id="n28084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of hoe for tearing up weeds, a weeding-hook</hi>, = ligo (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28084.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu penitus latis eradere viscera marris Ne dubita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:72" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 166</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28084.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hook</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Silurus) in Danubio marris extrahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 14, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1116" /> <cb n="MARS" /></sense></entryFree>
marrubium: <entryFree id="n28085" type="main" key="marru^bi^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marrŭbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant horehound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marrubium quod Graeci prasion vocant, alii linostrophon, nonnulli philopaeda, aut philochares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 241</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:105" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 16, 19, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:356" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 356</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28086" type="main" key="Marru^bi^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrŭbĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Latium, the capital of the Marsians</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Benedetto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:507" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 507</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n28086.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrŭbĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Marrubium, Marrubian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marrubia gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 750</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrŭvĭi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrŭvīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Marrubium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marrucini: <entryFree id="n28087" type="main" key="Marru_ci_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrūcīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Marūcīni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Italy, on the Adriatic coast, near the river Aternus, whose chief city was</hi> Teate, now <hi rend="ital">Chieti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 11 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrūcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Marrucini, Marrucinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 83, 85, § 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:521" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:566" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 566</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marrūcīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Marrucine manner</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">faithfully</hi>, since the faithfulness of the Marrucini was proverbial, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mars: <entryFree id="n28088" type="main" key="Mars"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mars</orth> (archaic and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> Māvors, q. v.), Martis (collat. reduplic. form Marmar, in the Song of the Arval Brothers; v. the following, and Mamers), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root mar-, gleam; Sanscr. marīkis, beam of light; hence Mars, the bright god; cf.: marmor, mare</etym>, <sense id="n28088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Mars, who, as father of Romulus, was the primogenitor of the Roman people, the god of war, of husbandry, of shepherds and seers. For him was named the month of</hi> Martius, <hi rend="ital">March, the beginning of the Roman year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 73</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">legio Martia ... ab eo deo, a quo populum Romanum generatum accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars pater te precor quaesoque, uti sies volens propitius mihi, etc., ... ut tu morbos visos invisosque viduertatem vastitudinemque, calamitates intemperiasque prohibessis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl></cit>; cf., in the Song of the Arval Brothers, NEVE LVERVE MARMAR SINS INCVRRERE IN PLEORIS; <cit><quote lang="la">for Mars pater, the forms Marspiter, gen. Marspitris, or -tĕris, and Maspiter were also employed,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 33</bibl> Müll.; 9, § 75; 10, § 65; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 695</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars Gradivus, Quirinus, Silvanus, Ultor, v. under h. vv.: Mars durus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> E 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortibus sane oculis Cassius (Martem spirare dicens) se in Siciliam non iturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 11</bibl></cit>. The Salii were destined for his service, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 4</bibl>; horses and bulls were offered to him, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Martem, a soldier's oath,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 21</bibl></cit>. He was often appealed to in oaths, etc., esp. by soldiers: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam neque Duellona mi umquam neque Mars creduat, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28088.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28088.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">War, battle, a conflict, engagement, contest</hi>, etc.; also <hi rend="ital">the art of war</hi>: cum veter occubuit Priamus sub Marte Pelasgo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 17 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Martem accendere cantu,</quote> <trans><tr>to incite to battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apertus,</quote> <trans><tr>fighting in the open field</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 27</bibl></cit>: equitem suo alienoque Marte pugnare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fight both in their own fashion</hi> (on horseback) <hi rend="ital">and in one which was strange to them</hi> (on foot), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna jam in manus, jam in gladios, ubi Mars est atrocissimus, venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terribili Marte ululare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captam sine Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:401" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos amisimus cives, eos Martis vis perculit, non ira victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars forensis,</quote> <trans><tr>a contest in the forum, legal contest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et fora Marte suo litigiosa vacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:188" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 188</bibl></cit>.—Hence, prov.: suo (nostro, vestro) Marte, <hi rend="ital">by one's own exertions, without the assistance of others</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ipse suo Marte res suas recuperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vos vestro Marte his rebus omnibus abundetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28088.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The issue of a war</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a battle, the fortune of war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis belli Mars communis, et cum semper incerti exitus proeliorum sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: communis<cb n="MARS" />  adhuc Mars belli erat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo Marte,</quote> <trans><tr>with equal advantage, on equal terms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequato Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verso Marte ( = versā fortunā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vario Marte pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerto Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28088.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The planet Mars</hi>: Jovis stellae proximum inferiorem orbem tenet <foreign lang="greek">puro/eis</foreign>, quae stella Martis appellatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 46, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 15, 12, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:42" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martis sidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28088.5" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mar-tĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Māvortĭus</orth>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28088.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 566</bibl></cit>; cf.: Martius lupus, integer et intactus, gentis nos Martiae et conditoris nostri admonuit, <hi rend="ital">descended from Mars</hi> (since Mars is the father of Romulus and Remus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Romulus and Remus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Areopagus at Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 718</bibl></cit> Oud.: Campus; <cit><quote lang="la">v. campus: harena,</quote> <trans><tr>a place in the Circus where the gladiators fought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:282" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 282</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:75:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 75, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Field of Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: Martius mensis, <hi rend="ital">the month of March</hi>, formerly the first month of the year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martii Calendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: Idus Martiae, <hi rend="ital">the Ides of March</hi>, famous as the day on which Julius Cæsar was killed, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 4, 2</bibl>; cf. 14, 20, 1 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:35:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 35, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 28, 1</bibl>.— In the form Mavortius (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:208" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Thebans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 531</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seges belli (because sprung from the dragon's teeth),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28088.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28088.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Warlike, martial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martia Penthesilea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martia saeculi voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martius aeris rauci canor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where many wars were carried on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28088.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the planet Mars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille fulgor rutilus, horribilisque terris, quem Martium dicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mar-tĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. mensis), <hi rend="ital">March, the month of March</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mensium nomina fere aperta sunt, si a Martio, ut antiqui constituerunt, numeres, Nam primus a Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28088.10" n="IV" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28088.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mars</hi>: Flamen, Varr L. L. 5, § 84 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">7, § 45 ib.: lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>in honor of Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>: Martialis collis, <hi rend="ital">near the temple of</hi> Deus Fidius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 52</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a priest of Mars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martiales quidam Larini appellabantur, ministri publici Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28088.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to the</hi> legio Martia; hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭāles</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the soldiers of the</hi> legio Martia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marsaci: <entryFree id="n28089" type="main" key="Marsa^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsăci</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsăcĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Belgica.—Marsacii, Plin 4, 15, 29, § <cit><quote lang="la">101: Marsaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marsi: <entryFree id="n28090" type="main" key="Marsi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n28090.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people in Latium, on the</hi> Lacus Fucinus, <hi rend="ital">celebrated as wizards and snake-charmers; in the Social War the most zealous enemies of the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41</bibl> sq.; 26, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:section=6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001::section=13" default="NO">§ 13</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:33:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 33, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28090.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n28090.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Marsi, Marsian</hi>: augur, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 2, 33, 70</bibl>: manus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 251</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 280 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 758</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: cellae (for the wine; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Marsicus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:116" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nenia,</quote> <trans><tr>incantations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:29" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28090.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Marsian, Marsic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:496" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:121" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28090.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Germany, between the Rhine, Lippe, and Ems</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marsigni: <entryFree id="n28091" type="main" key="Marsigni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsigni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Germany, a part of the Suevi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marspedis: <entryFree id="n28092" type="gloss" key="Marspedis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marspedis</orth> sive sine r littera maspedis<cb n="MAS" />  in precatione solitaurilium quid significet, ne Messalla quidem augur in explanatione auguriorum reperire se potuis se ait, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=161" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 161</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
marspiter: <entryFree id="n28093" type="main" key="Marspi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marspĭter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, v. Mars <sense id="n28093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
marsupium: <entryFree id="n28094" type="greek" key="marsu_pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marsūpĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-suppium</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">marsu/pion</foreign>, <sense id="n28094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouch, purse</hi> (ante- and postclass.): curam marsupii habere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 142, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi aurei in marsupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom inspicio marsupium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exenterare,</quote> <trans><tr>to empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 600</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 6, 311</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marsus: <entryFree id="n28095" type="main" key="Marsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Marsi, I. B. 1.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28096" type="main" key="Marsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Domitius Marsus, <sense id="n28096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epigrammatic poet in the time of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:71:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 71, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marsyas: <entryFree id="n28097" type="main" key="Marsy^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsyas</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*marsu/as</foreign>, <sense id="n28097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a satyr who challenged Apollo to a trial of skill on the flute, and whom the latter vanquished and flayed alive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:705" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 705</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 383</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, 3, p. 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:186" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 186</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">near his statue in the Roman forum was the place for the transaction of business</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:64:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 64, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Ben. 6:32:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Ben. 6, 32, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28098" type="main" key="Marsy^as2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marsyas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the name of several rivers. <sense id="n28098.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Greater Phrygia, which flows into the Mæander</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tschinar Tchai</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 400</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28098.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of two rivers in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
martes: <entryFree id="n28099" type="hapax" key="martes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">martes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">captā marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:37:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 37, 18</bibl></cit> dub. (al. mele or maele).</sense></entryFree>
martialis: <entryFree id="n28100" type="main" key="Marti^a_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Mars, IV. B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28101" type="main" key="Marti^a_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, M. Valerius Martialis, <sense id="n28101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a native of Bilbilis, in Spain, a celebrated epigrammatic poet under Domitian, Nerva, and Trajan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
martianus: <entryFree id="n28102" type="main" key="Marti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Marc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n28102.0" n="I" level="1"> Aelius Martianus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman jurist, a pupil of Papinian under Alexander Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28102.1" n="II" level="1"> Martianus Capella, v. Capella.</sense></entryFree>
martiaticus: <entryFree id="n28103" type="main" key="Marti^a^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Mars</etym>, <sense id="n28103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">martial, military</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1284</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
marticola: <entryFree id="n28104" type="main" key="Marti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Mars-colo</etym>, <sense id="n28104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worshipper of Mars</hi> (only in Ovid): <cit><quote lang="la">Getes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 14, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marticultor: <entryFree id="n28105" type="gloss" key="Marti^cultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭcultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Mars-cultor</etym>, <sense id="n28105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worshipper of Mars</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2397</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
martigena: <entryFree id="n28106" type="main" key="Marti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Mars-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n28106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Mars-born, begotten by Mars</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Martigenae ... Romulus Iliades, Iliadesque Remus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martigena Quirinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 199</bibl></cit>: vulgus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">martial</hi>, Sil 16, 533.</sense></entryFree>
martiobarbulus: <entryFree id="n28107" type="main" key="marti^obarbu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">martĭobarbŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mattĭob-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Mars</etym>, <sense id="n28107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier provided with leaden balls</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 17</bibl> dub.; cf. the context.</sense></entryFree>
martius: <entryFree id="n28108" type="main" key="Marti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Martĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Mars, III.</entryFree>
martulus: <entryFree id="n28109" type="main" key="martu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">martŭlus</orth>, v. 1. marculus.</entryFree>
martyr: <entryFree id="n28110" type="greek" key="martyr"><orth extent="full" lang="la">martyr</orth>, <itype>yris</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/rtur</foreign>, <sense id="n28110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a witness;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">one who by his death bears witness to the truth of the Christian religion, a martyr</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">salvete flores Marty rum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 17, 6</bibl> —In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perpetua, fortissima martyr,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
martyrium: <entryFree id="n28111" type="greek" key="marty^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">martyrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">martu/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n28111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a testimony, sealed with one's blood, to the truth of the Christian religion, martyrdom</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28111.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">martyrii palmae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Greg. M. Dial. 3, 28: Domini martyrium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1</bibl></cit>: sanguine martyrii, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 7, 9: sacri martyrii corona, Ambros, Off. 2, 28.—</sense><sense id="n28111.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28111.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The place where a martyr is buried, a martyr's grave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">martyria negat esse facienda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 46</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28111.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A church</hi> dedicated to a saint: <cit><quote lang="la">martyrium fabricare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vita Hilar. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marucca: <entryFree id="n28112" type="main" key="Marucca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marucca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Batica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marullus: <entryFree id="n28113" type="main" key="Ma^rullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. C. Epidius Marullus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl>. —In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:55:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 55, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marum: <entryFree id="n28114" type="greek" key="ma^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">măron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n28114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. Teucrium Marum, Linn.; <hi rend="ital">catthyme</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 24, 53, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 2, 2, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marus: <entryFree id="n28115" type="main" key="Marus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Dacia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the March</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Morana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mas: <entryFree id="n28116" type="main" key="ma_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mās</orth>, <itype>măris</itype> (<gen>n.</gen> mare, rare; <sense id="n28116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur</hi> <pb n="1117" /> <cb n="MASC" /> marium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 10, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prob. from Sanscr. root man, think; manus, man, human being; cf.: memini, moneo, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">male, masculine, of the male sex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare et femineum sexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 66 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maribus (sc. diis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si marem (anguem) emisisset ... si feminam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">emissio maris anguis (opp. emissio feminae anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:29:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 29, 62</bibl></cit>: mas vitellus, <hi rend="ital">a male yolk</hi>, i. e. which would produce a male chick, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 14</bibl>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">ure mares oleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:741" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 741</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28116.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">masculine, manly, brave</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod mares homines amant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maribus Curiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male mas,</quote> <trans><tr>unmanly, effeminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque marem strepitum fidis intendisse Latinae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a manly, noble strain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mās</orth>, <itype>māris</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a male</hi> (opp. femina, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n28116.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of gods, human beings, and animals: <cit><quote lang="la">congressio maris et feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mares deos et feminas esse dicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bestiarum) aliae mares, aliae feminae sunt ... et in mare et in femina, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">feminaque ut maribus conjungi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 853</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marium expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">marium pignora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum in maribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos tollite laudibus, mares, Delon Apollinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28116.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">in tilia mas et femina differunt omni modo: namque et materies dura ac nodosa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 14, 25, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognati virilis sexus, per mares descendentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 26, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
masada: <entryFree id="n28117" type="main" key="Masada"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masada</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Judæa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sebbeh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 17, 15, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
masaesyli: <entryFree id="n28118" type="main" key="Masaesy_li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masaesȳli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Massaesyli.</entryFree>
masati: <entryFree id="n28119" type="main" key="Masa_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mascarpio: <entryFree id="n28120" type="hapax" key="mascarpi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascarpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mas-carpo</etym>, i. q. masturbator, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134, 5</bibl> dub.</entryFree>
masculatus: <entryFree id="n28121" type="hapax" key="mascula_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">masculātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mas</etym>, <sense id="n28121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">male</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurialis masculata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
masculesco: <entryFree id="n28122" type="hapax" key="mascu^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n28122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [masculus], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn male</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">densiore satu (rapa) masculescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
masculetum: <entryFree id="n28123" type="main" key="mascu^le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where male plants are planted</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
masculine: <entryFree id="n28124" type="main" key="mascu^li_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlīnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. masculinus <sense id="n28124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
masculiniter: <entryFree id="n28125" type="hapax" key="mascu^li_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlīnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. masculinus <sense id="n28125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> * B.</sense></entryFree>
masculinus: <entryFree id="n28126" type="main" key="mascu^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>masculus</etym>, <sense id="n28126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">male, masculine;</hi> of human beings, animals, and plants (not in Cic.; perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28126.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <trans><tr>the male parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 190, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapa rotunda masculini sexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 25, § 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28126.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28126.3" n="a" level="4"> (Cf. masculus, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Manly, worthy of manhood</hi>: masculini viri, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 20</bibl>; al. leg. masculi.—</sense><sense id="n28126.4" n="b" level="4"> In gram., of gender, <hi rend="ital">masculine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">masculina Graeca nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quaeratur, funis masculinum sit an femininum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: masculino genere cor enuntiavit Ennius, Caesell. Vindex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n28126.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the masculine gender</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl>: masculine etiam dicebant frontem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=151" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 151</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum masculine veteres dixerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl></cit> P. —* </sense><sense id="n28126.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlīnĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the masculine gender</hi>, Vet. Interpr. Iren. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
masculofemina: <entryFree id="n28127" type="hapax" key="mascu^lo^fe_mi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlŏfēmĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>masculusfemina</etym>, <sense id="n28127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man-woman, hermaphrodite</hi>, Vet. Interpr. Iren. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
masculus: <entryFree id="n28128" type="main" key="mascu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mascŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [mas], <hi rend="ital">male, masculine; subst., a male</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n28128.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona femina, et malus masculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertus infans natus masculus an femina esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus masculum femininumve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 68, 87, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 65</bibl></cit>; Ov. Med. fac. 94; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare mascula nomina rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:43:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 43, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido, i. e. tribadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:41" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28128.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28128.3" n="A" level="2"> Of things: cardo, <hi rend="ital">which is inserted into another</hi> (opp. cardo femina, into which another is inserted), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; v. cardo; <cit><quote lang="la">of gems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28128.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Worthy of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">befitting a man, manly, vigorous, bold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sappho,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 21</bibl></cit>: ingenium,<cb n="MASS" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl>, p. 190, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">indicium masculi et incorrupti viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 20</bibl></cit>; v. masculinus.</sense></entryFree>
masei: <entryFree id="n28129" type="main" key="Mase_i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masēi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
masgaba: <entryFree id="n28130" type="hapax" key="Masga^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masgăba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n28130.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of King Masinissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28130.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A favorite of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
masicitus: <entryFree id="n28131" type="main" key="Masicitus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masicitus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
masinissa: <entryFree id="n28132" type="main" key="Ma^si^nissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măsĭnissa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Măsănīsa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 4, 18</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Numidia, grandfather of Jugurtha, at first the enemy and afterwards the friend and ally of the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 34</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10</bibl>; 65, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:769" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 769</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:117" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maso: <entryFree id="n28133" type="main" key="Maso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maso</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Masso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Papiria; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. C. Papirius Maso (Masso),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 38, § 126</bibl></cit>; Fast. Capitol. ad a. 523; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 23, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maspedis: <entryFree id="n28134" type="main" key="Maspedis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maspedis</orth>, v. Marspedis.</entryFree>
maspetum: <entryFree id="n28135" type="greek" key="maspe^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maspĕtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma:speton</foreign>, <sense id="n28135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the leaf of the</hi> laserpitium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maspiter: <entryFree id="n28136" type="gloss" key="Maspi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maspĭter</orth>, i. q. Marspiter, v. Mars.</entryFree>
massa: <entryFree id="n28137" type="greek" key="massa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">massa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/za</foreign>, <sense id="n28137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which adheres together like dough, a lump, mass</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">massa picis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis coacti,</quote> <trans><tr>cheese</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis alligati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:64:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 64, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of metals: <cit><quote lang="la">versantque tenaci forcipe massam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chalybis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:405" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:130" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 130</bibl></cit>.—Of money: <cit><quote lang="la">tum argenti montis, non massas habet: Aetna non aeque altast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 73</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a mass of gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contactu gleba potenti Massa fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 112</bibl></cit>: marmoris, <hi rend="ital">a block of marble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor, non in columnis crustisve, sed in massa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 8, § 49</bibl></cit>.—Of chaos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 70</bibl>.—Of a heavy weight, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:421" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 421</bibl>.—Of an indeterminate quantity of land, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4360</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28138" type="main" key="Massa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28138.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Terentius Massa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 35</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28138.2" n="2" level="3"> Baebius Massa, <hi rend="ital">a notorious informer and sycophant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28138.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a slave</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
massaesyli: <entryFree id="n28139" type="main" key="Massaesy_li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massaesȳli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Masaes-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*massaisu/lioi</foreign>, <sense id="n28139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massaesȳlia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Massæsyli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 9, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
massagetae: <entryFree id="n28140" type="main" key="Massa^ge^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massăgĕtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*massage/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n28140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people, to the east of the Caspian Sea</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Sangaria</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Mongolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 307</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">retusum in Massagetas Arabasque ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 40</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">sing. collect.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massăgĕtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Massagetæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 283</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massageten monstrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:360" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 360</bibl></cit>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 312</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
massala: <entryFree id="n28141" type="main" key="Massala"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massala</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Arabia Felix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
massalioticus: <entryFree id="n28142" type="main" key="Massa^li^o_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massălĭōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Massilia, C.</entryFree>
massalis: <entryFree id="n28143" type="main" key="massa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">massālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. massa</etym>, <sense id="n28143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mass, that constitutes a mass</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">massalis moles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chaos</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 30</bibl></cit>: summa, <hi rend="ital">the All-embracer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Christ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">massālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a mass, all together</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
massaliter: <entryFree id="n28144" type="main" key="massa_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">massālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. massalis <sense id="n28144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
massaris: <entryFree id="n28145" type="main" key="massa^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">massăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grape from a wild vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 61, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes">23</bibl> prooem. 5, § 9.</sense></entryFree>
massaticius: <entryFree id="n28146" type="main" key="massa_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">massātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>massa</etym>, <sense id="n28146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of masses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lumps</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Agrim.</author> p. 265</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
massicus: <entryFree id="n28147" type="main" key="Massi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (with or without mons), <sense id="n28147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Campania, celebrated for its excellent wine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Massico</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per juga Massici montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertunt felicia Baccho Massica qui rastris (sc. juga, or arbusta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Massici radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massĭcum vīnum</orth>, or simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mas-sĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wine of the Massicus, Massic wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris pocula Massici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 526</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
massilia: <entryFree id="n28148" type="main" key="Massi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*massali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n28148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated seaport town in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">a colony from Phocæa, and a seat of Greek</hi> <cb n="MAST" /> <hi rend="ital">civilization</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Marseilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:169" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 257</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28148.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Massilia, Massilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:123" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 123</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n28148.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mas-sĭlĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Massilia, Massilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sybaritic, luxurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massĭlĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Massilia, Massilians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">transf. for Massilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28148.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massĭlĭōtĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massălĭōtĭcus</orth> (acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*massaliwtiko/s</foreign>), a, um, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Massilia, Massiliotic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium Rhodani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 635</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28148.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massī^lītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Massilitan;</hi> in tmesi: Massili portabant juvenes ad litora tanas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> p. 1777</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 605 Vahl.).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massī^lītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Massilians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28148.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massĭlĭtānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wine of Massilia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:123" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 123</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
masso: <entryFree id="n28149" type="greek" key="masso1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">masso</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/ssw</foreign>, <sense id="n28149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chew</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28150" type="main" key="Masso2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. Maso.</entryFree>
massula: <entryFree id="n28151" type="main" key="massu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">massŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. massa</etym>, <sense id="n28151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little lump</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mass</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 48, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
massurius: <entryFree id="n28152" type="main" key="Massu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massŭrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Măsŭrĭus</orth>) <itype>Sabinus</itype>, <sense id="n28152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated jurist in the time of the emperor Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19 al" default="NO">5, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Masuri rubrica vetavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:90" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 90</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Masŭrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Massurius</hi>: deliramenta, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Caes. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Caes. 2, 9</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
massycites: <entryFree id="n28153" type="main" key="Massyci_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massycītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Masicitus.</entryFree>
massyli: <entryFree id="n28154" type="main" key="Massy_li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Massȳli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*massu/lioi</foreign>, <sense id="n28154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Africa, to the east of the</hi> Massaesyli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:512" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 512</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:171" default="NO">16, 171</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 4, 46; <cit><quote lang="la">called Maesuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28154.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massȳ-lus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massȳlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Massyli, Massylian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massyli equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <trans><tr>that guarded the orchards of the Hesperides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:94:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 94, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massylia signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:184" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28154.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Massȳlaeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mas-sylēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*massulai=os</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*massulei=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Massylians, Massylian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mastarna: <entryFree id="n28155" type="main" key="Mastarna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mastarna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient</hi> (Tuscan) <hi rend="ital">name of</hi> Mons Coelius, Oratio Claudii Aug. ap. Grut. 502.</sense></entryFree>
mastaurenses: <entryFree id="n28156" type="main" key="Mastaurenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mastaurenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city of</hi> Mastaura <hi rend="ital">in Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
masticatio: <entryFree id="n28157" type="main" key="masti^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mastico</etym>, <sense id="n28157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chewing, mastication</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibum masticatione exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:70" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mastichatus: <entryFree id="n28158" type="main" key="masti^cha_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭchātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mastĭcātus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mastiche</etym>, <sense id="n28158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seasoned with mastic</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 19, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
