mastiche: <entryFree id="n28159" type="greek" key="masti^che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭchē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mastĭcē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">masti/xh</foreign>, <sense id="n28159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mastic, an odoriferous gum from the mastic-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 36, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:96" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 16, 56, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:122" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 20, 25, § 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 19</bibl>.— Post-class. collat. forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭchum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ma-stĭcum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 3</bibl> (al. mastichae), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mastix</orth>, <itype>mastĭchis</itype>, <case>abl.</case> mastichĕ, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">447</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mastichinus: <entryFree id="n28160" type="greek" key="masti^chi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭchĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mastĭcĭnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">masti/xinos</foreign>, <sense id="n28160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mastic, mastic-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mastichum: <entryFree id="n28161" type="main" key="masti^chum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭchum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mastĭcum</orth>), v. mastiche.</entryFree>
mastico: <entryFree id="n28162" type="main" key="masti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n28162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to chew</hi> (post-class.): aliquid, Pelag. Vet. 30; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>: portulaca mastucata, Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 10.</sense></entryFree>
mastigia: <entryFree id="n28163" type="greek" key="masti_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastīgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mastigi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n28163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scoundrel, rascal, rogue</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28163.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (anteclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non manum abstines, mastigia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28163.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a whip, scourge</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mastigo: <entryFree id="n28164" type="greek" key="masti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastīgo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mastigo/w</foreign>, <sense id="n28164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="1118" /> <cb n="MATE" /> <hi rend="ital">whip, scourge</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Serm. de Rat. Circumcis. p. 489</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mastigophorus: <entryFree id="n28165" type="greek" key="masti_go^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastīgŏphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mastigofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n28165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whip-bearer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a beadle, policeman</hi>, an officer whose duty it was to maintain order at the public shows (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mastix: <entryFree id="n28166" type="main" key="mastix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastix</orth>, <itype>ĭchis</itype>, v. mastiche <sense id="n28166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mastos: <entryFree id="n28167" type="greek" key="mastos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">masto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant good for the breast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 92, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mastruca: <entryFree id="n28168" type="foreign" key="mastru_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastrūca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mastrūga</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sardinian; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n28168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment made of skins, a sheepskin, a skin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mastrucam, quod Sardum est, inridens Cicero ex industria dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mastruca vestis Sardonica ex pelliculis ferarum, de qua Cicero pro Scauro: Quem purpura regalis non commovit, eum Sardorum mastruca mutavit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 23, 5</bibl></cit> (Orell. Cic. Fragm. Scaur. § 45, d, p. 268); so <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Symm. 2, 695</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">As a term of abuse,</quote> <trans><tr>a sheepskin, a ninny</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mastrucatus: <entryFree id="n28169" type="hapax" key="mastru_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mastrūcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mastruca</etym>, <sense id="n28169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in a mastruca</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in skins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
masturbator: <entryFree id="n28170" type="main" key="masturba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">masturbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>masturbor</etym>, <sense id="n28170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who defiles himself</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:203:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 203, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
masturbor: <entryFree id="n28171" type="main" key="masturbor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">masturbor</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>perhaps from manus-stupro</etym>, <sense id="n28171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile one's self</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:42:7" default="NO">9, 42, 7</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form masturbat, <foreign lang="greek">de/fei, de/fetai</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
masucium: <entryFree id="n28172" type="gloss" key="masuci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">masucĭum</orth> <itype>edacem a mandendo scilicet</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=139" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 139</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
masurianus: <entryFree id="n28173" type="main" key="Masu^ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masŭrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Massurius.</entryFree>
masurius: <entryFree id="n28174" type="main" key="Masurius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Masurius</orth>, v. Massurius.</entryFree>
matara: <entryFree id="n28175" type="hapax" key="mata^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. materis.</entryFree>
mataris: <entryFree id="n28176" type="main" key="mata^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matăris</orth>, v. materis.</entryFree>
mataxa: <entryFree id="n28177" type="main" key="mataxa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mataxa</orth>, v. metaxa.</entryFree>
matella: <entryFree id="n28178" type="main" key="ma^tella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mătella</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mătēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>matula</etym>, <sense id="n28178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pot, a vessel</hi> for liquids. </sense><sense id="n28178.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: matella aquae, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 543, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">mus in matella, of a person in difficulty,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28178.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a chamber-pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:89:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 89, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:119" default="NO">14, 119</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 26, 2</bibl>.—Hence, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">matellam praestare alicui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to perform for one the most menial offices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a prostitute, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matellio: <entryFree id="n28179" type="main" key="ma^telli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mătellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>matula; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=119" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 119</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126</bibl> ib.</etym>, <sense id="n28179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pot, vessel</hi> (class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mateola: <entryFree id="n28180" type="main" key="mate^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, perh. <sense id="n28180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mallet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beetle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (talea) parum descendet, malleolo aut mateola adigito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 45, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">46, 2</bibl> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 29, § 126</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
mater: <entryFree id="n28181" type="main" key="ma_ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root ma-; Sanscr. and Zend, to make, measure, like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mh/thr</foreign>, the maker, akin with Dor. <foreign lang="greek">ma/thr</foreign>; Germ. Mutter; Engl. mother; cf.: materies, manus</etym>, <sense id="n28181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mother</hi> (<hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> matre, Corp. Inscr. Lat. 177; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> matris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrabus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2089</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n28181.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem istius regis (sc. Anci Martii) matrem habemus, ignoramus patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non sit heres matri suae?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pietate in matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sassia mater hujus Aviti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecate, quae matre Asteria est,</quote> <trans><tr>who has Asteria for her mother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musa, matre nati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: mater esse de aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to be a mother</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be pregnant by any one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquam matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 491</bibl></cit>: mater familias or familiae, <hi rend="ital">the mistress of a house, matron</hi> (v. familia).—</sense><sense id="n28181.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a nurse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater sua ... quae mammam dabat, neque adeo mater ipsa, quae illos pepererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero opust cibo, opus est autem matri quae puerum lavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5</bibl></cit> 10: <cit><quote lang="la">lambere matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 632</bibl></cit>.—As a title of honor, <hi rend="ital">mother</hi>, applied to priestesses: jubemus te salvere, mater. <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Salvete puellae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amice benigneque honorem, mater, nostrum habes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—To goddesses: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesta mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Excerpt. Contr. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Excerpt. Contr. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 498</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater Matuta, v. h. v.: Flora mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 739</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same: florum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:183" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 183</bibl></cit>: mater magna, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: Mater, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cybele, the mother of all the gods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris magnae sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: matris <cb n="MATE" /> quate cymbala circum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta palatia Matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres ... cives Romanae, ut jus liberorum consecutae videantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris condicionem sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:81" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; cf. §§ 67, 86.—Also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a woman, a lady;</hi> usu. in <hi rend="ital">plur., women, ladies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilentis matres in mollibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres atque viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 306</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:619" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 619</bibl>.—Of the earth, as the mother of all: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Dis Manibus matrique Terrae deberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 56</bibl>.—Of a country: <cit><quote lang="la">haec terra, quam matrem appellamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">porci cum matribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excretos prohibent a matribus haedos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova assunt ipsis cum matribus, i. e. cum gallinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater simia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:195" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus hirundinis ad quem volat mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 232</bibl></cit>.—Of the trunks of trees, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas tenero abscindens de corpore matrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">fountain</hi>, as the <hi rend="ital">source</hi> of waters: <cit><quote lang="la">ex grandi palude oritur (fluvius), quam matrem ejus accolae appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of a chief or capital city: <cit><quote lang="la">mater Italiae Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Graeci dicere solent, urbium mater, Cydona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cilicia) matrem urbium habet Tarsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 38</bibl></cit>; cf. Metropolis.—</sense><sense id="n28181.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28181.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The mother</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">maternal love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul matrem labare sensit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 629</bibl></cit>: mater redit, Sen. ap. Med. 928.—</sense><sense id="n28181.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Motherhood, maternity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 389" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 389</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28181.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A producing cause, origin, source</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">apes mellis matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater omnium bonarum artium sapientia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia mater omnium bene factorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiae mater, luxuries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas, malorum mater omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 21, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris et religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae imbecillitas mater est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperantia omnium perturbationum mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudo est satietatis mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:41:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 41, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas justi prope mater et aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 83:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 83, 1</bibl>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (sc. hirneam) ego vini ut matre fuerat natum, eduxi meri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as it came from the cask, without the addition of water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 274</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28181.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The protector, shelter, home</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Roma, virtutum omnium mater, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 5, 3, 1: illa Jerusalem quae est mater nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 4, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matercula: <entryFree id="n28182" type="main" key="ma_tercu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātercŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mater</etym>, <sense id="n28182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little mother</hi> (class.): tune igitur mea matercula? Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 601</bibl> P.: materculae suae festivus filius, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
materfamilias: <entryFree id="n28183" type="main" key="ma_terfa^mi^li^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māterfămĭlĭas</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">māter fămĭ-lĭas</orth>, v. familia.</entryFree>
materia: <entryFree id="n28184" type="main" key="ma_te^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n28184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> materiāi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1051" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1051</bibl>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (only in <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi>, and once <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> materierum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 383), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from same root with mater, q. v.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">stuff, matter, materials</hi> of which any thing is composed; so <hi rend="ital">the wood of a tree, vine</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">timber</hi> for building (opp. lignum, wood for fuel); <hi rend="ital">nutritive matter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">substance</hi> for food (class.). </sense><sense id="n28184.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28184.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">materia rerum, ex qua et in qua sunt omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam superabat opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae apparatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chaos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: omnis fere materia nondum formata rudis appellatur, Cinc. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=265" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 265</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbor) inter corticem et materiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crispa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 28, 51, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae longitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis in materiam, frondemque effunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil valet materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam insulam materiam, calcem, caementa, atque arma convexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus non potest videri materies propter exilitatem, sed lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae, lignorum aggestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum est ut materies suppetat scutariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proba materies est, si probum adhibes fabrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: imprimebatur sculptura materiae anuli, sive <cb n="MATE" /> ex ferro sive ex auro foret, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm imagines mortalibus materiis in species hominum effingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of food: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillissimam materiam esse omnem caulem oleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18, 39</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf. of the <hi rend="ital">means of subsistence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumere omnem materiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 876</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">matter</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">materies aliqua mala erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—In abstract, <hi rend="ital">matter, the material universe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus ex materia ortus est, aut materia ex Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28184.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">matter of suppuration, pus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 27, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28184.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stock, race, breed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex vetere materia nascitur, plerumque congeneratum parentis senium refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosa (equorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n28184.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28184.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The matter, subjectmatter, subject, topic, ground, theme</hi> of any exertion of the mental powers, as of an art or science, an oration, etc.: materiam artis eam dicimus in qua omnis ars et facultas, quae conficitur ex arte, versatur. Ut si medicinae materiam dicamus morbos ac vulnera, quod in his omnis medicina versetur; <cit><quote lang="la">item quibus in rebus versatur ars et facultas oratoria, eas res materiam artis rhetoricae nominamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi materia, quam tractet, et in qua versetur, subjecta est veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim deformitatis et corporis vitiorum satis bella materies ad jocandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 32, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: materies crescit mihi, <hi rend="ital">my matter</hi> (for writing about) <hi rend="ital">increases</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 12, 3</bibl>: rei. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequa viribus,</quote> <trans><tr>a subject suited to your powers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra materiam juris,</quote> <trans><tr>the province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:191" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28184.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cause, occasion, source, opportunity</hi> (cf. mater, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim odisset Clodium Milo segetem ac materiam suae gloriae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl></cit> (for which shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">fons perennis gloriae suae): materies ingentis decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praebiturum se illi eo die materiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam invidiae dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam bonitati dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benefaciendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid materiae praeberet Neroni,</quote> <trans><tr>occasion of jealousy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae, quae materiam sermonibus praebuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere materiam causasque jocorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiamque sibi ducis indulgentia quaerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28184.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Natural abilities, talents, genius, disposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, fuisse in isto C. Laelii, M. Catonis materiem atque indolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis humanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam ingentis publice privatimade decoris omni indulgentia nostra nutriamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>.—Hence, one's <hi rend="ital">nature, natural character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum materia digna perire tua,</quote> <trans><tr>thy unfeeling disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28184.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A subject, argument, course of thought, topic</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tertium diem esse, quod omni labore materiae ad scribendum destinatae non inveniret exordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum plura significat ... omnem ad scribendum destinatam materiam ita appellari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video non futurum finem in ista materia ullum, nisi quem ipse mihi fecero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcritudinem materiae considerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam ex titulo cognosces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit> al. (materies animi est, materia arboris; <cit><quote lang="la">et materies qualitas ingenii, materia fabris apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:II. p. 481" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> II. p. 481</bibl></cit> Mai.; but this distinction is not observed by class. writers).</sense></entryFree>
materialis: <entryFree id="n28185" type="main" key="ma_te^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>materia</etym>, <sense id="n28185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to matter, material</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">influxio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Virg. 3, 1, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mā-tĕrĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to the occasion</hi> (postclass.): in pectore viri iracundia materialiter regnans. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
materiarius: <entryFree id="n28186" type="main" key="ma_te^ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to stuff, matter, wood, timber</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28186.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fabrica,</quote> <trans><tr>carpentry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FABER,</quote> <trans><tr>a carpenter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 642, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOCIATOR,</quote> <trans><tr>a timber-merchant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4248</bibl></cit>. —Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n28186.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. negotiator), <hi rend="ital">a timber-merchant</hi>: si non <pb n="1119" /> <cb n="MATH" /> hos materiarius remoratur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">CLAVORVM,</quote> <trans><tr>a maker of wooden nails</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28186.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">haeretici materiarii, in eccl. Lat.,</quote> <trans><tr>those who believed in the eternity of matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28186.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. negotiatio), <hi rend="ital">the trade in timber</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27, 11</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
materiatio: <entryFree id="n28187" type="hapax" key="ma_te^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>materia</etym>, <sense id="n28187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woodwork</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">beams, rafters</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
materiatura: <entryFree id="n28188" type="hapax" key="ma_te^ri^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working in wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiatura fabrilis,</quote> <trans><tr>carpenter's work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
materies: <entryFree id="n28189" type="main" key="ma_te^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, v. materia.</entryFree>
materinus: <entryFree id="n28190" type="hapax" key="ma_te^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>materia</etym>, <sense id="n28190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hard, solid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 34, 2</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
materio: <entryFree id="n28191" type="main" key="ma_te^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭo</orth> (no <sense id="n28191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to build of wood</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eaque aedificia minime sunt materianda propter incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes male materiatae,</quote> <trans><tr>of bad wood-work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
materiola: <entryFree id="n28192" type="main" key="ma_te^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small matter</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Baptism. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
materior: <entryFree id="n28193" type="hapax" key="ma_te^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">procure wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat eo tempore et materiari et frumentari necesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
materiosus: <entryFree id="n28194" type="gloss" key="ma_te^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātĕrĭōsus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">polu/u+los</foreign> (multam materiam habens), Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
materis: <entryFree id="n28195" type="foreign" key="mate^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matĕris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">matăris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">madăris</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">matăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n28195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtic javelin, pike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulli inter carros rotasque mataras ac tragulas subiciebant nostrosque vulnerabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humero matari trajecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materis Transalpina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl></cit>: Galli materibus configunt, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maternus: <entryFree id="n28196" type="main" key="ma_ternus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mater</etym>, <sense id="n28196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mother, maternal</hi> (class.): sanguis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 292, 16</bibl> (Trag. v. 184 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">paternus maternusque sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <trans><tr>the months of pregnancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>time of pregnancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 312</bibl></cit>: Caesar cingens maternā tempora myrto, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Venus</hi>, the mother of Æneas, from whom sprang the race of the Cæsars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma (Aeneae),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which his mother Venus had obtained for him from Vulcan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the doves sacred to Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Atlas, the father of Maia, the mother of Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delum maternam invisit Apollo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where his mother Latona had borne him</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 144</bibl></cit>: aequora, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from which she</hi> (Venus) <hi rend="ital">was born</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:131" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numa,</quote> <trans><tr>related by the mother's side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 2, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an ad maternos Latinos hoc senatus consultum pertineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:71" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas,</quote> <trans><tr>by the mother's side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 340</bibl></cit>: Idus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of May</hi> (Mercury's birthday), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:71" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 71</bibl> 5—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">ut agnus condiscat maternum trahere alimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdix materna vacans cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28197" type="main" key="Ma_ternus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māternus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curiatius Maternus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matertera: <entryFree id="n28198" type="main" key="ma_terte^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātertĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for materitera, mater and an obsol. <hi rend="ital">fem. noun</hi> found in <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> i-terum; cf. al-tera, a second mother</etym>, <sense id="n28198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mother's sister, an aunt</hi> by the mother's side: <cit><quote lang="la">amita est patris soror: matertera est matris soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ib. § 5: mea matertera (anulum gestitavit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 312</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materteram uxorem ducere non licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:62" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 62</bibl></cit>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 2, 2.—</sense><sense id="n28198.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n28198.2" n="A" level="2"> Magna, i. e. aviae soror, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1, § 15</bibl>; cf.: matertera patris et matris, mihi magna matertera est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=136" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 136</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n28198.3" n="B" level="2"> Major, i. e. soror proaviae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1, § 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28198.4" n="C" level="2"> Maxima, i. e. abaviae soror, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mathematice: <entryFree id="n28199" type="main" key="ma^the_ma^ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măthēmătĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. mathematicus, II. B.</entryFree>
mathematicus: <entryFree id="n28200" type="greek" key="ma^the_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măthēmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">maqhmatiko:s</foreign>, <sense id="n28200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mathematics, mathematical</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28200.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mathematica nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>geometry, arithmetic, astronomy, music, geography, optics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28200.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28200.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măthēmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28200.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mathematician</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 3, 10</bibl>; id. <cb n="MATR" /> Ac. 2, 36, 116; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28200.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An astrologer</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mathematici, genus hominum potentibus infidum, sperantibus fallax, quod in civitate nostra et vetabitur semper et retinebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota mathematicis genesis tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:248" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de salute principis ... mathematicos consulit, cum eo qui responderit, capite punitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28200.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măthēmătĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28200.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mathematics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 23</bibl>; v. l. <orth extent="full" lang="la">mă-thēmătĭcē</orth> ( = <foreign lang="greek">maqhmatikh/</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>).— </sense><sense id="n28200.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Astrology</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addictus mathematicae, persuasionisque plenus, cuncta fato agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mathesis: <entryFree id="n28201" type="greek" key="ma^the_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măthēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (with the second syll. short: <sense id="n28201.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">involvit măthĕsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 893 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 131</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/qhsis</foreign> (lit., knowledge, science; hence, in partic.). </sense><sense id="n28201.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mathematics, mathesis</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrifariae mathesis januae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28201.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Astrology</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mathesin scire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ael. Vel. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Firm. Math. 1 praef. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 479</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matho: <entryFree id="n28202" type="main" key="Ma^tho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mătho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rich speculator, afterwards a bankrupt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:129" default="NO">7, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matilica: <entryFree id="n28203" type="main" key="Matili^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Matilĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Umbria</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Matelica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Colon. p. 100" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Colon. p. 100</bibl> Goes.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Matilĭcātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Matilica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matinus: <entryFree id="n28204" type="main" key="Ma^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mătīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promontory in Apulia, near the foot of Mount Garganus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Matinata</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 185</bibl>; Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28204.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mă-tīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount Matinus, Matinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apis Matinae More,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28204.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mătīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a mountain in</hi> Apulia Daunia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matisco: <entryFree id="n28205" type="main" key="Matisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Matisco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Æduans, in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Arar, the modern <hi rend="ital">Maçon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:90:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 90, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matius: <entryFree id="n28206" type="main" key="Ma^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mătĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n28206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Cn. Matius, <hi rend="ital">a poet and translator of the Iliad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:14" default="NO">9, 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:5:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 5, § 96</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. the same with C. Matius,</quote> <trans><tr>a friend of Cæsar and Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 2, 6, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:2 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 2 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28206.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mătĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Matius, Matian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of apple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:5" default="NO">12, 47, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Fer. Als. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Fer. Als. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Minutal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matrae: <entryFree id="n28207" type="gloss" key="Matrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Matrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n28207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> MATRABVS, for Matris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 29, 1</bibl>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Matres</orth>, more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Matronae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the protecting goddesses of a country, city</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">MATRIS AVGVSTIS D. D.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 90, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
matralis: <entryFree id="n28208" type="main" key="ma_tra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mater</etym>, <sense id="n28208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a mother</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Matralia festa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:533" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 533</bibl></cit>, or simply Matralia, <hi rend="ital">the festival of</hi> Mater Matuta, i. e. Ino, <hi rend="ital">celebrated annually on the</hi> 11<hi rend="ital">th of June</hi>: Matralia Matris Matutae festa, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 125</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Matralibus id faciunt matronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=106" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 106</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ite, bonae matres, vestrum Matralia festum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:475" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festa Matralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:533" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 533</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matresco: <entryFree id="n28209" type="hapax" key="ma_tresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n28209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to become a mother, to become like one's mother</hi> (ante-class.): utinam nunc matrescam ingenio, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 7</bibl> dub. (Trag. Rel. v. 139 Rib., maturescam): matrescere, <foreign lang="greek">mhtra/zein</foreign>, Onomast. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
matricalis: <entryFree id="n28210" type="main" key="ma_tri_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrīcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>matrix</etym>, <sense id="n28210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the womb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">matrix</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matricida: <entryFree id="n28211" type="main" key="ma_tri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrĭcīda</orth> (scanned matrĭcĭda, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 291</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>mater-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n28211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mother's murderer, a matricide</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quem scribis certissimum matricidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantavit Oresten matricidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">matrique cida Nero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> de XII. Caes. 35</bibl></cit> (al. matrīcīda Nero).</sense></entryFree>
matricidium: <entryFree id="n28212" type="hapax" key="ma_tri^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrĭcīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>matricida</etym>, <sense id="n28212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the murder of one's mother, matricide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusari matricidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matricula: <entryFree id="n28213" type="main" key="ma_tri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>matrix</etym>, <sense id="n28213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public register, list, roll</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 20, 3</bibl>. <cb n="MATR" /></sense></entryFree>
matriculus: <entryFree id="n28214" type="hapax" key="matricu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matricŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown fish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matrimes: <entryFree id="n28215" type="gloss" key="matrimes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matrimes</orth>, v. matrimus <sense id="n28215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
matrimonialis: <entryFree id="n28216" type="main" key="ma_tri^mo_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrĭmōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>matrimonium</etym>, <sense id="n28216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to marriage, matrimonial</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae, Firm. Math. 7, 17: lectulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matrimonium: <entryFree id="n28217" type="main" key="ma_tri^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mater</etym>, <sense id="n28217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wedlock, marriage, matrimony</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28217.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ire in matrimonium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be married</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium dare, opp. in concubinatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: alicujus tenere, <hi rend="ital">to be one's spouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Q. Metelli matrimonium tenuisse sciebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium dare alicui filiam suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to give in marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium ducere alicujus filiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to marry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium petere sibi aliquam,</quote> <trans><tr>to ask in marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium collocare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give in marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium collocare (filiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:235" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:238" default="NO">238</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locare in matrimonio stabili et certo,</quote> <trans><tr>to take in marriage, marry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Phil. 2:18:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonio uxorem exigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to put her away, repudiate her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonio exturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere aliquam e matrimonio,</quote> <trans><tr>to put her away, to repudiate, divorce her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justum matrimonium est, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>lawful marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non justo contractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:87" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28217.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">plur., married women, wives</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonia et pecudes hostium praedae destinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">severius matrimonia sua viri coercerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5" default="NO">3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5" default="NO">18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonia a finitimis petita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matrimus: <entryFree id="n28218" type="main" key="ma_trimus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrimus</orth> (the quantity of the i is doubtful), a, um, (collat. form: matrimes ac patrimes dicuntur, quibus matres et patres adhuc vivunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126</bibl> Müll.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a mother living</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem ingenui, decem virgines, patrimi omnes matrimique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; Auct. Har. Resp. 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl>; cf. patrimus.</sense></entryFree>
matrix: <entryFree id="n28219" type="main" key="ma_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mother</hi> in respect to propagation (in lit. signif. not used of women). </sense><sense id="n28219.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a breeding-animal</hi>: of <hi rend="ital">breeding-cows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 12</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">breeding-ewes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 12</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">laying-hens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:11" default="NO">8, 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28219.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28219.3" n="1" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">the parent-stem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28219.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The womb, matrix</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">matricis dolor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:13:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 13, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28219.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A public register, list, roll</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matricibus beneficiariorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. in Persec. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28219.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a source, origin, cause</hi> (cf. mater, II.; <cit><quote lang="la">eccl. Lat.): Eva matrix generis feminini,</quote> <trans><tr>the progenitress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordialis lex data Adae, quasi matrix omnium praeceptorum Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Haer. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrix et origo cunctorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Valent. 7</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Venus</hi>, Inscr. Orell, 1373.</sense></entryFree>
matrona: <entryFree id="n28220" type="main" key="ma_tro_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a married woman, wife, matron</hi> (whether she was in manu or not; consequently more general in its application than mater familias, which always denoted one who was in manu). </sense><sense id="n28220.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: matronam dictam esse proprie, quae in matrimonium cum viro convenisset, quoad in eo matrimonio maneret, etiamsi liberi nondum nati forent: dictamque esse ita a matris nomine non adepto jam sed cum spe et omine mox adipiscendi: unde ipsum quoque matrimonium dicitur; <cit><quote lang="la">matrem autem familias appellatam esse eam solam, quae in mariti manu mancipioque, aut in ejus, in cujus maritus, manu mancipicque esset: quoniam non in matrimonium tantum, sed in familiam quoque mariti, et in sui heredis locum venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 6, 8</bibl></cit> and 9: <cit><quote lang="la">convocatis plebeis matronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—Only rarely of <hi rend="ital">a married woman, woman</hi> in general: <cit><quote lang="la">ut matronarum hic facta pernovit probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (dea) quia partus matronarum tueatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: et fetus matrona dabit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:91" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prole matronisque nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyranni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: matronae muros complent, Enn. ap. Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 18</bibl> (Ann. v 376 Vahl.): tum muros variā cinxere coronā Matronae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 476</bibl>: matronae tacitae spectent, tacitae rideant <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 32</bibl> <pb n="1120" /> <cb n="MATT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronas prostratae pudicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilectae adulter matronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:319" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 319</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28220.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n28220.3" n="A" level="2"> The word very early acquired the accessory idea of (moral or social) dignity, rank.
