Matronae is thus used even by Ennius of <hi rend="ital">women of quality, ladies</hi>: matronae opulentae, optimates, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 294 Vahl.); cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in like manner, in Plautus: ubi istas videas summo genere natas Summates matronas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Cicero applies to the noble women carried off from the Sabines the term matronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrona laris,</quote> <trans><tr>the lady of the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28220.4" n="B" level="2"> With the accessory idea of estimable, virtuous, chaste, etc.: nominis matronae sanctitudinem, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam hic ornatam adducas ad matronarum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 196</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">matronarum sanctitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VETERIS SANCTITATIS MATRONA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2739</bibl></cit>. So opp. meretrix, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 80</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut matrona meretrici dispar erit atque Discolor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae praeter faciem nil cernere possis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis matrona pudici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28220.5" n="C" level="2"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Juno</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc matrona Juno (stetit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MATRONIS IVNONIBVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2085</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of other protecting goddesses of places,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2081 sq.</bibl></cit> (But not of vestals; v. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 12</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28221" type="main" key="Matro^na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Matrŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 462</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Pan. 812</bibl>), <sense id="n28221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Gaul</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Marne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 462</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matronalis: <entryFree id="n28222" type="main" key="ma_tro_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. matrona</etym>, <sense id="n28222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a married woman</hi> or <hi rend="ital">matron, womanly, matronly</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">oblitae decoris matronalis,</quote> <trans><tr>of womanly honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam illi anilis prudentia, matronalis gravitas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the stola</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <trans><tr>the matron's cheeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:828" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 828</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">7: sedulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 8.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mātrōnā-lĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated by matrons in honor of Mars, on the 1st of March, at which presents were given to matrons and brides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:229" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:84:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 84, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: Matronales feriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrōnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a matron</hi>: MATRONALITER NVPTA, <hi rend="ital">as lawful wife</hi> (opp. to a concubine), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 46, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matronatus: <entryFree id="n28223" type="main" key="ma_tro_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dress of a matron</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lady of rank</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matroum: <entryFree id="n28224" type="spur" key="Matro_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Matrōum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mhtrw=on</foreign>, a false read. for Matrem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 115</bibl>.</entryFree>
matruelis: <entryFree id="n28225" type="main" key="ma_tru^e_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātrŭēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mater</etym>, <sense id="n28225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mother's brother's son, a cousin-german, first-cousin</hi> on the mother's side (cf. patruelis, a father's brother's son; <cit><quote lang="la">post class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; Vict. de Orig. Gentis Rom. 13, 8.</sense></entryFree>
matta: <entryFree id="n28226" type="main" key="matta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mat</hi> made of rushes, Aug. contr. Faust. 5, 5; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:117" default="NO">6, 117</bibl> (also v. l. for lata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:679" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 679</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
mattarius: <entryFree id="n28227" type="main" key="Matta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mattārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>matta</etym>, <sense id="n28227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sleeps on a mat</hi> (late Lat.), a name applied by the orthodox to a sect of Manichæans: quia in mattis dormiunt, Mattarii appellantur, Aug. contr. Faust. 5, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Haeres. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mattea: <entryFree id="n28228" type="greek" key="matte^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mattĕa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mattya</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mactĕa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mattu/a</foreign> (v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:22:section=112" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 22, § 112</bibl> Müll.), <sense id="n28228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dainty dish, dainty, delicacy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 65</bibl>: to mattea sola juvat (al. juvant, assuming a collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mattĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:59:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 59, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quadrupedes mattea prima lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:92:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 92, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matteola: <entryFree id="n28229" type="main" key="matte^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mattĕŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">matĕŏla</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mactĕŏla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mattea</etym>, <sense id="n28229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little delicacy, dainty</hi> (post class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 231</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matthaeus: <entryFree id="n28230" type="main" key="Matthaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Matthaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*matqai=os</foreign>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mattheus</orth> (eu diph.), <sense id="n28230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">St. Matthew the evangelist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mattheus, as a dissyl.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 982</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mattiacus: <entryFree id="n28231" type="main" key="Matti^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mattĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mattiacum</hi> (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Wiesbaden</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Mattiaci fontes,</quote> <trans><tr>the warm mineral springs of Wiesbaden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 17, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae,</quote> <trans><tr>soap-balls for coloring the hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:27" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MATU" /> —In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mattĭăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mattiacum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mattici: <entryFree id="n28232" type="main" key="Mattici"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mattici</orth> <itype>cognominantur homines malarum magnarum atque oribus late patentibus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126</bibl> Müll. [<foreign lang="greek">matu/ai</foreign>, i. q. <foreign lang="greek">gna/qoi</foreign>, acc. to Hesych.].</entryFree>
mattiobarbulus: <entryFree id="n28233" type="main" key="matti^obarbu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mattĭobarbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. martiobarbulus.</entryFree>
mattiocopa: <entryFree id="n28234" type="greek" key="matti^o^co^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mattĭŏcŏpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mattu/a-ko/ptw</foreign></etym>, prop. <sense id="n28234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutter of dainties;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a skinflint</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mattium: <entryFree id="n28235" type="main" key="Matti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mattĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Germany, the capital of the Chatti;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">Marburg;</hi> acc. to others, the town of <hi rend="ital">Maden</hi>, near Fritzlar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mattus: <entryFree id="n28236" type="hapax" key="mattus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mattus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">matus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. mad, to be drunk; cf. madidus</etym>, <sense id="n28236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drunk, intoxicated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
mattya: <entryFree id="n28237" type="main" key="matty^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mattya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. mattea.</entryFree>
matula: <entryFree id="n28238" type="main" key="ma^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mătŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel, pot</hi> for liquids (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n28238.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">continentur mundo muliebri specula, matulae, unguenta, vasa unguentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 10</bibl></cit>. As a term of abuse, <hi rend="ital">a simpleton, noodle</hi> (cf. Engl. colloq., <hi rend="ital">a vessel</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ego te tam esse matulam credidi. Quid metuis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 64</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: Est modus matulae, <hi rend="ital">we should observe moderation</hi>, the title of a satire of Varro.—</sense><sense id="n28238.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a chamber-pot, urinal</hi>: matula vas urinae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 125</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
matura: <entryFree id="n28239" type="main" key="Ma_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maturus</etym>, <sense id="n28239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess that presides over the ripening of fruits</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 8 (al. Matuta).</sense></entryFree>
maturate: <entryFree id="n28240" type="main" key="ma_tu_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. maturo <sense id="n28240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maturatio: <entryFree id="n28241" type="hapax" key="ma_tu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maturo</etym>, <sense id="n28241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hastening, accelerating</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maturator: <entryFree id="n28242" type="main" key="ma_tu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrātor</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who urges on, a hastener</hi> (late Lat.): itineris inchoati, Ven. Fort. Mauril. 15.</sense></entryFree>
mature: <entryFree id="n28243" type="main" key="ma_tu_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. maturus <sense id="n28243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maturefacio: <entryFree id="n28244" type="main" key="ma_tu_re^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>maturus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n28244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make ripe, to ripen, mature</hi> (post-class.), Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 14.</sense></entryFree>
maturesco: <entryFree id="n28245" type="main" key="ma_tu_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n28245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [maturus], <hi rend="ital">to become ripe, ripen, to come to maturity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28245.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">cum maturescere frumenta inciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus maturescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 44, § 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28245.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: partus maturescunt ... novem lunae cursibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 69</bibl>: nubilibus maturuit annis, <hi rend="ital">ripened to marriageable years</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a marriageable age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros opinabar nondum satis maturuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Inst. Ep. ad Tryph. 1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Inst. Ep. ad Tryph. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si virtutes ejus maturuissent,</quote> <trans><tr>had come to maturity, to perfection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maturitas: <entryFree id="n28246" type="main" key="ma_tu_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n28246.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ripeness, maturity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28246.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque multum a maturitate aberant (frumenta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">frumentorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 49</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celerius occidere festinatam maturitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>an accelerated, precocious maturity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 10.—</sense><sense id="n28246.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper time</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">perfection, ripeness, maturity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturitates gignendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad maturitatem perducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturitatem adipisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: aestiva, <hi rend="ital">fullness of heat</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 343, 21</bibl> (Rep. 4, 1, 1 B. and K.): <cit><quote lang="la">muriae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>its proper strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis ad prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus rei maturitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere maturitatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:318" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 92, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturitatem Galli criminando,</quote> <trans><tr>mental maturity, ripe understanding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">veteris imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indeflexa aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum maturitates, mutationes, vicissitudinesque,</quote> <trans><tr>the maturing of the seasons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 62, 155</bibl>; but: si maturitas temporum, expectata foret, <hi rend="ital">the full time</hi>, when the supplies would be exhausted, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 40, 9</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n28246.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">ripe fruit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28246.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Gentleness, mildness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28246.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Promptness, expedition</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturitatem beneficio Caesaris praestare,</quote> <trans><tr>to hasten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 105" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maturo: <entryFree id="n28247" type="main" key="ma_tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <cb n="MATU" /> <sense id="n28247.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to make ripe, ripen, to bring to ma turity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28247.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 102</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: maturari, <hi rend="ital">to grow ripe, ripen, to come to maturity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta maturantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia maturata,</quote> <trans><tr>ripened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva maturata dulcescit,</quote> <trans><tr>ripe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 13, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28247.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make ripe, to ripen, mature, soften, bring to maturity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis alba suppurationes veteres maturat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupini strumas maturant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus conceptos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 14, 43, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivas muria,</quote> <trans><tr>to make ripe, soft, eatable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass., to become ripe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soft, to come to maturity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova in sicco maturari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 57, 83, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumen aestivis solibus maturatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concoctione maturata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28247.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten, accelerate, quicken, despatch, expedite</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28247.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum ad coepta maturanda redire jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 61, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem ea res maturat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi exitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturatur recordatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem praedae suae morte maturare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28247.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf., to make haste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi> to do a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">jube maturare illam exire huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Axonam exercitum transducere maturavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab urbe proficisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter pergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28247.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hurry too much, precipitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni Catilina maturasset signum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>had not Catiline given the signal too soon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussis ceteris quantum possent maturare sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28247.7" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa quae mox caelo properanda sereno, maturare datur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to do in good time, betimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28247.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28247.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow ripe, ripen</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ficus, quae sero maturant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28247.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make haste, hasten</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">successor tuus non potest ita maturare, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati in Africam maturantes veniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et maturavit Romanus, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturandum ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facto maturatoque opus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam maturato opus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">betimes, quickly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 58</bibl></cit>; also: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi> (late Lat.), Schol. Verg. ap. Clan. Auct. Mai. vol. 7, p. 291.</sense></entryFree>
maturus: <entryFree id="n28248" type="main" key="ma_tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n28248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> usually maturissimus; <cit><quote lang="la">less freq. maturrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. the <pos>adv.</pos>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root, Sanscr. ma-, measure, time, whence mane, matutinus; cf.: manus, modus; hence, timely, ready in time</etym>, <hi rend="ital">ripe, mature</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28248.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">poma matura et cocta (opp. cruda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturissimae ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges matura messi,</quote> <trans><tr>ripe for harvesting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod maturi erat (opp. viride),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n28248.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28248.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ripe, mature, of the proper age, proper, fit, seasonable, timely</hi>, etc.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia matura viro,</quote> <trans><tr>ripe for marriage, marriageable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturus bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus templis maturus et arae,</quote> <trans><tr>old enough for sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis,</quote> <trans><tr>fit for bearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roxane matura ex Alexandro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <trans><tr>ripe for delivery, ready to bring forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>mature, fit for action</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progenies matura militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52</bibl></cit>: L. Caesar viris, <hi rend="ital">of the proper age for assuming the</hi> toga virilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:99" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 99</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Piur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūri</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adults</hi> (opp. pueri), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia matura sunt, victoria, praeda, laus,</quote> <trans><tr>ready to be seized</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 48</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:657" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 657</bibl></cit>.—Of mental qualities: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse enim Thucydides, si posterius fuisset, multo maturior ac mitior fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis gravis atque animi maturus Aletes,</quote> <trans><tr>mature in judgment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi,</quote> <trans><tr>ripe in years</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones,</quote> <trans><tr>who had served out their time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <trans><tr>old, antiquated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi tempus maturius,</quote> <trans><tr>more seasonable, more favorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: mihi vero ad nonas bene maturum videtur fore, <hi rend="ital">just</hi> <pb n="1121" /> <cb n="MATU" /> <hi rend="ital">at the right time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se maturam oppetere mortem,</quote> <trans><tr>in good old age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 115</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28248.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Powerful, vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebasque jacentis Pulverolenter coquat maturis solibus aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes (anni),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturae mala nequitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>full-grown depravity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:216" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 216</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28248.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That takes place early, early, speedy, quick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittam hodie huic suo die natali malam rem magnam et maturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: matura faba, <hi rend="ital">the early bean</hi> (opp. to the late bean), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satio (opp. to late sowing),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: fenum, <hi rend="ital">the first hay</hi> (opp. to the after-math), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <trans><tr>early</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>quick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur aetatis quam maturrimum precari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas maturissima,</quote> <trans><tr>early life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mora pro culpa est, ego sum maturior illo,</quote> <trans><tr>was there earlier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 300</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūrē</orth> (<hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> maturissime and maturrime; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n28248.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Seasonably, opportunely, at the proper time</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">custodes mature sentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis mature occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi consulueris, mature facto opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n28248.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Betimes, early, speedily, quickly, soon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mature fieri senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturius proficiscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturius pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus quam res maturius me deserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturius ad Epulas ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluerunt veteres maturius hereditates adiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:55" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: maximos tumultus maturissime disjeci, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 184</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">res maturissime vindicanda est,</quote> <trans><tr>as quickly, as early as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe qui omnium maturrime ad publicas causas accesserim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perge qua coeptas, ut quam maturrime merita invenias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 16</bibl></cit> Dietsch.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus quam maturrime occurrendum putabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n28248.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prematurely, untimely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater mature decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—With a play upon the three meanings of the word (A., B., and C.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui homo mature quaesivit pecuniam, Nisi eam mature parsit, mature esurit,</quote> <trans><tr>he who has made money at the right time, if he is not soon sparing of it, will too soon suffer hunger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matus: <entryFree id="n28249" type="main" key="matus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">matus</orth>, v. mattus.</entryFree>
matuta: <entryFree id="n28250" type="main" key="Ma_tu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mātūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root ma- of mane, maturus, q. v.</etym>. <sense id="n28250.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Matuta, the goddess of the morning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dawn</hi>, identical with Aurora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 656</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28250.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of Ino</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*leukoqe/a</foreign>), called by the Romans also Mater Matuta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:479" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 479</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 545</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ino, postquam se praecipitavit, Leucothea, materque Matuta (dicta est),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">who had a temple at Rome,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 33</bibl>; 7, 27; 25, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">and at Satricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
matutinalis: <entryFree id="n28251" type="main" key="ma_tu_ti_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūtīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>matutinus</etym>, <sense id="n28251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the morning, early, morning-</hi> (post-class.): tempus, Auct. Carm. Phil. 15.</sense></entryFree>
matutine: <entryFree id="n28252" type="main" key="ma_tu_ti_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūtīnē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūtīnō</orth>, <sense id="n28252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. matutinus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
matutinus: <entryFree id="n28253" type="main" key="ma_tu_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Matuta; cf.: mane, manus, maturus</etym>, <sense id="n28253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the morning, morning-</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>the morning hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi, i. e. Aurorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:160" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii,</quote> <trans><tr>the morning sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:125:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 125, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the morning-hunt in the Circus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cliens,</quote> <trans><tr>who comes early in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:68:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 68, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <trans><tr>who is saluted early in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas se matutinus agebat,</quote> <trans><tr>was up early</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 465</bibl></cit>: pater, i. e. Janus, <hi rend="ital">who</hi> (as the god of time) <hi rend="ital">was invoked early in the morning, that he might promote business</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter matutino Tiberi mergetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:523" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutino sudans amomo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28253.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sober, serious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:2:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūtīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the morning, morning-</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere matutinis, meridie metere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 90</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n28253.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūtī-nē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the morning, early in the morning</hi>, only ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 635</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n28253.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mātūtīnō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">early in the morning</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl>, <cb n="MAVO" /> 53, 54, § 181; 19, 12, 60, § 183; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, 17, p. 166</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24</bibl>, p. 198 al.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 168</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 402</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
maurella: <entryFree id="n28254" type="hapax" key="maurella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maurella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, Macer. Cam. 2, 34.</sense></entryFree>
mauretania: <entryFree id="n28255" type="main" key="Maure_ta_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurētānĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Maurīt-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Mauri, C.</entryFree>
mauri: <entryFree id="n28256" type="main" key="Mauri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mauri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*mau=roi</foreign>), <sense id="n28256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Moors, Mauritanians, the inhabitants of</hi> Mauritania: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime Hispaniam Mauri sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 10</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:91" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 15, 29, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Moor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 678</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28256.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mau=ros</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Moors, Moorish, Mauritanian;</hi> also <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maurae manus, i. e. Poenorum arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:213" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda, i. e. mare Africum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae filia Maurae, i. e. e citro facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:90:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 90, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes, i. e. citrini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28256.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Moorish</hi>: Maurica planta, Coripp. Joann. 2, 137.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:28:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 28, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mau-rĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a Moor</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:25:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 25, 8</bibl>.— And <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurĭcātim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like a Moor</hi>: Mauricatim scire, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 184</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 16 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n28256.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurītā-nĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Maurēt-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mauritani/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a country of Africa, on the Mediterranean, between the Atlantic Ocean and Numidia</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Fez</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Morocco;</hi> having been divided into <hi rend="ital">M. Cæsariensis</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Tingitana</hi>, it was called also in the <number>plur.</number> Mauritaniae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurītānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mauritania</hi>: exercitus, on a coin of Hadrian, in Eckhel. D. N. V. t. 6, p. 498.—</sense><sense id="n28256.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurūsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maurousi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Greek name of Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28256.5" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurūsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Moorish, Mauritanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:66:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 66, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28256.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maurou/sios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Maurusian, Mauritanian, African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:414" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 414</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maurūsĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Mauritanians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mausoleum: <entryFree id="n28257" type="main" key="Mauso_le_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mausōlēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Mausolus, II. A.</entryFree>
mausolus: <entryFree id="n28258" type="main" key="Mauso_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mausōlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mau/swlos</foreign>, <sense id="n28258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Caria, husband of Artemisia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n28258.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mausōlēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mausolus, Mausolean</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28258.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 59; or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mausōlēum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēsōlum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4370</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mauswleion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the magnificent tomb erected for Mausolus by his wife Artemisia;</hi> it was one of the seven wonders of the world, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl>(4), 1, 59. —</sense><sense id="n28258.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a splendid sepulchre, mausoleum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:64:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 64, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vitell. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mavolo: <entryFree id="n28259" type="main" key="ma_vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māvŏlo</orth>, v. malo <sense id="n28259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mavors: <entryFree id="n28260" type="main" key="Ma_vors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māvors</orth>, <itype>vortis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from mah, magh, to cut; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/xh, ma/xaira</foreign>, and vor, root of vortere; i. e. the turner of the battle</etym>, old and poetic name for Mars (q. v.), the god of war, etc. <sense id="n28260.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Mavortis, i. e. Rome,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 872</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 630</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 569</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mavors pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:178" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor Mavors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:828" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 828</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliae Mavortisque puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Romulus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28260.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">war, battle</hi>: civili Mavorte, Aus Idyll. 4, 65.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māvortius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mavors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Mars</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">moenia, i. e. Rome,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:208" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Thebans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 531</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seges Mavortia belli,</quote> <trans><tr>the armed men that sprang up where the dragon's teeth were sown</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 135</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māvortius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Meleager, son of Mavors</hi>, Ov M. 8, 437; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 471" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 471</bibl>; but of <hi rend="ital">Mars</hi>, Petr. poët. 124, v. 261; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 57, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to war, warlike, martial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:90" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:626" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 344</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mavortius: <entryFree id="n28261" type="main" key="Ma_vorti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māvortĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Mars. <cb n="MEAT" /></entryFree>
maxentius: <entryFree id="n28262" type="main" key="Maxenti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maxentĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 54" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 54</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28262.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maxentĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Maxentius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 44, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maxilla: <entryFree id="n28263" type="main" key="maxilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maxilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of a ground-form magsula (whence māla; root mag of <foreign lang="greek">ma/ssw</foreign>, to knead; <foreign lang="greek">mageu/s</foreign>. baker, etc.; cf. axilla, ala, from ago)</etym>, <sense id="n28263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the jawbone, jaw</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n28263.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam litteram (X) etiam e maxillis et taxillis et vexillo ... consuetudo elegans Latini sermonis evellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxillae superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 60, § 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 40, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxillam superiorem commovere solam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in maxillis balanatum gausape pectas,</quote> <trans><tr>you comb the anointed beard on your jaws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n28263.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: miserum populum, qui sub tam lentis maxillis erit, <hi rend="ital">under such slowgrinding teeth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">subject to such protracted cruelty</hi>, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maxillaris: <entryFree id="n28264" type="main" key="maxilla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maxillāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>maxilla</etym>, <sense id="n28264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the jaw, maxillary</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>the maxillary teeth, grinders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 63, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 26, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:139" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 50, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maxillo: <entryFree id="n28265" type="gloss" key="maxillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maxillo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">stomokopw=</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</entryFree>
maxime: <entryFree id="n28266" type="main" key="maxi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maxĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maxŭmē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. magnus <sense id="n28266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maximitas: <entryFree id="n28267" type="main" key="maxi^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maxĭmĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maxŭmĭtas</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maximus</etym>, <sense id="n28267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness, magnitude</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in maximitatem producere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 204</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maximopere: <entryFree id="n28268" type="main" key="maxi^mo^pe^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maxĭmŏpĕre</orth>, v. magnopere.</entryFree>
maximus: <entryFree id="n28269" type="main" key="maxi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maxĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maxŭm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. magnus.</entryFree>
maza: <entryFree id="n28270" type="greek" key="ma_za"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/za</foreign>, <sense id="n28270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frumenty</hi>, for feeding dogs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 307</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mazaca: <entryFree id="n28271" type="main" key="Ma_za^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māzăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/zaka</foreign>, <sense id="n28271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief city of Cappadocia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kaisariyeh</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 66, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 6</bibl>. —Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māzăca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 244</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māzăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mazaces: <entryFree id="n28272" type="main" key="Ma_za^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māzăces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n28272.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Numidia</hi>, afterwards called Mazacenses: <cit><quote lang="la">Mazacum turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">sing. collect.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mazax</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 681</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 356</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28272.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people near the Palus Mæotis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 6, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mazagae: <entryFree id="n28273" type="main" key="Mazagae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mazagae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mazices: <entryFree id="n28274" type="main" key="Mazi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mazĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/zikes</foreign>, <sense id="n28274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Numidia</hi>, the same with Mazaces, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 25, 21</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
mazonomus: <entryFree id="n28275" type="greek" key="ma_zo^no^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māzŏnŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (acc. to others, <orth extent="full" lang="la">māzŏnŏmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; the <gen>m.</gen> form corresponds with the Greek word <foreign lang="greek">mazonomos</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">ku/klos</foreign>), <sense id="n28275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dish, charger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde secuti Mazonomo pueri magno discerpta ferentes Membra gruis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 86</bibl></cit> (cf. Schol. Aug. ad loc.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> de Aucup. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
me: <entryFree id="n28276" type="main" key="me"><orth extent="full" lang="la">me</orth>, <itype>for mihi</itype>, v. ego <sense id="n28276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
meabilis: <entryFree id="n28277" type="main" key="me^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>meo</etym>. * <sense id="n28277.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., passable, that can be passed through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitus vel bubus meabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n28277.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., passing through, penetrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër per cuncta rerum meabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meaculum: <entryFree id="n28278" type="hapax" key="me^a_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a course, passage</hi> = meatus: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, superi caelestesque, vestra recensebitis meacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 813</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meamet: <entryFree id="n28279" type="main" key="me^a_met"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕāmet</orth>, for mea or mea ipsius: <sense id="n28279.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meapte: <entryFree id="n28280" type="main" key="meapte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">meapte</orth>, for mea or mea ipsius: <sense id="n28280.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meatim: <entryFree id="n28281" type="gloss" key="me^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>meus</etym>, <sense id="n28281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in my manner</hi>, analog. to tuatim, after thy manner; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 949</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> p. 1759</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
meator: <entryFree id="n28282" type="gloss" key="me^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>meo</etym>, <sense id="n28282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passenger, traveller, wanderer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">DOLE MEATOR QVISQVIS HOC LEGIS CARMEN, Inscr. ap. Guarin. in Prosod. Lat. Fundam. p. 133: INTERPRES DIVVM COELI TERRAEQVE MEATOR, of Mercury, as the messenger of the gods,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1417</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meatus: <entryFree id="n28283" type="main" key="me^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going, passing, motion, course</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28283.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis lunaeque meatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 850</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilae,</quote> <trans><tr>flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the breathing, respiration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1122" /> <cb n="MEDE" /> 16, 13.—</sense><sense id="n28283.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a way, path, passage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:403" default="NO"><author>Val.
