Fl.</author> 3, 403</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meatum vomiticnibus praeparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 13, 55, § 197</bibl></cit>: cur signa meatus Deseruere suos, <hi rend="ital">left their paths</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">became darkened, eclipsed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 664</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danubius in Ponticum sex meatibus erumpit,</quote> <trans><tr>discharges itself through six channels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bifido meatu divisus Rhenus,</quote> <trans><tr>divided into two channels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 336</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n28283.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The avenues of sensation</hi> in the body: <cit><quote lang="la">homo septem meatus habet in capite, duos oculos, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 739</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mecastor: <entryFree id="n28284" type="main" key="mecastor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mecastor</orth>, v. Castor.</entryFree>
mechanema: <entryFree id="n28285" type="greek" key="me_cha^ne_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēchănēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhxa/nhma</foreign>, <sense id="n28285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece of mechanism, a trick</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mechanicus: <entryFree id="n28286" type="greek" key="me_cha^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēchănĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhxaniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mechanics, mechanical</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28286.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: ars, Firm. Math. 6, 31.—</sense><sense id="n28286.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28286.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēchănĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a mechanic</hi>, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. petauristas, p. 206 Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sipho, quem diabeten vocant mechanici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28286.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mē-chănĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">mechanics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyriades mechanicae professor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:38" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28286.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēchănĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">works of mechanical art</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 61, p. 314, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mechanisma: <entryFree id="n28287" type="greek" key="me_cha^nisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēchănisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mechanical contrivance, mechanism</hi>, for mechanema (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mechir: <entryFree id="n28288" type="main" key="Mechir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mechir</orth>, <itype>iris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an Egyptian month, answering nearly to the Roman January and a part of February</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mecon: <entryFree id="n28289" type="greek" key="me_con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēcon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh/kwn</foreign>, <sense id="n28289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of poppy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium genus est tithymalon, mecona vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 19, 80, § 209</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meconis: <entryFree id="n28290" type="greek" key="me_co_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēcōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhkwni)s</foreign>, <sense id="n28290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lettuce with a milky juice of a soporiferous quality, like the poppy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:67" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 7, 26, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meconites: <entryFree id="n28291" type="greek" key="me_co_ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēcōnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhkwni/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n28291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone resembling a poppy</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meconium: <entryFree id="n28292" type="greek" key="me_co_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēcōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhkw/nion</foreign>. <sense id="n28292.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Poppy-juice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:142" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 12, 91, § 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28292.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant, called also</hi> peplis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 93, § 119</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28292.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The excrements of new-born children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 13, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mecum: <entryFree id="n28293" type="main" key="me_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēcum</orth>, i. e. cum me, <sense id="n28293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with me</hi>, like tecum, secum, etc., v. ego.</sense></entryFree>
med: <entryFree id="n28294" type="main" key="med"><orth extent="full" lang="la">med</orth>, <itype>for me</itype>, v. ego.</entryFree>
meddix: <entryFree id="n28295" type="main" key="meddix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">meddix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">medix</orth>), <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from the root med-, medeor; cf. Homeric <foreign lang="greek">me/dontes</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n28295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who cares for, attends to, a curator</hi>, the title of a <hi rend="ital">magistrate among the Oscans</hi>: meddix apud Oscos nomen magistratūs est. Ennius: summus ibi capitur meddix, occiditur alter, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 296" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 296</bibl> Vahl.).—With the epithet tuticus (which prob. answers to the summus of Ennius, and is allied to totus), joined into one word, meddixtuticus or medixtuticus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is summus magistratus erat Campanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 35, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medea: <entryFree id="n28296" type="main" key="Me_de_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (arch. <sense id="n28296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Medeaï, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 127, v. 292</bibl> Vahl.; <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdē</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 130, v. 311</bibl> Vahl.), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdīa</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mh/deia</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated sorceress, daughter of Æetes, king of Colchis. She assisted her lover, Jason the Argonaut, in obtaining the golden fleece, accompanied him to Greece, and prevented her father, who was in pursuit, from overtaking them, by strewing the sea with her brother's limbs. When Jason afterwards repudiated her, in order to marry Creusa, she killed the children she had had by him, and burned the bride to death in her palace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">item ut Medea Peliam concoxit senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 9</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 21:22:25" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 21, 22, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pueros coram populo Medea trucidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 185</bibl></cit>.—The subject of tragedies by several authors, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28296.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28296.2" n="1" level="3"> Medea Palatina, i. e. Clodia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28296.3" n="2" level="3"> Medea nigra, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone, so named after Medea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28296.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., Medean, magical</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Medeides herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medela: <entryFree id="n28297" type="main" key="me^de_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdēla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdella</orth>, Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 204</bibl>; Schol. Bob. ad Cic. Red. ad Quir. <cb n="MEDI" /> p. 251, 8 Bait.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>medeor</etym>, <sense id="n28297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a healing, cure, a remedy</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n28297.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere medelam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere medelarum miracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus medelas adhibere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28297.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy, means of redress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus veluti medela adventus Alexandri fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medens: <entryFree id="n28298" type="main" key="me^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. medeor <sense id="n28298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
medeon: <entryFree id="n28299" type="main" key="Mede^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Medĕon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*medew/n</foreign>. <sense id="n28299.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28299.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medeor: <entryFree id="n28300" type="main" key="me^de^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĕor</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <sense id="n28300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [root madh, to be wise; Zend, madha, the healing art; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ma/qos</foreign>, also medicus, re-med-ium], <hi rend="ital">to heal, cure, be good for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> a disease (syn.: medico, sano, curo); constr. with <case>dat.</case>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, very rarely with <case>acc.</case> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28300.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28300.2" n="A" level="2"> Of pers. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">medico non solum morbus ejus, cui mederi volet, cognoscendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum capiti mederi debeam, reduviam curo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to neglect matters of importance while attending to trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28300.3" n="B" level="2"> Of subjects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">contra serpentium ictus mederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis herba chelidonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolori dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medendi ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the healing art, art of medicine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 735</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 526</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex vino stomachi dolor medeatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medendae valetudini leniendisque morbis opem adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28300.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to remedy, relieve, amend, correct, restore</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n28300.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies stultis quoque mederi solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodis omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictae et perditae rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiae rei frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum satietati, tum ignorantiae lectorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to provide against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei alicui lege aut decreto senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28300.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (cupiditates) mederi possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae medendis corporibus nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrescit medendo,</quote> <trans><tr>his disorder increases with the remedy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut huic vitio medeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> medentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 629</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">subst., a physician</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">veluti pueris absinthia tetra medentes cum dare conantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 936</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Democrates e primis medentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 49, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:22" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medi: <entryFree id="n28301" type="main" key="Me_di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mh=doi</foreign>, <sense id="n28301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Medes;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also for <hi rend="ital">the Assyrians, Persians, Parthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 386</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:53" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 53</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medusque et Indus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:604" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 604</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28301.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Median, Assyrian</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hydaspes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acinaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit> (4, 11), 11: flumen, i. e. doubtless <hi rend="ital">the Euphrates</hi>, the most famous river of the remote East; though some understand it to mean <hi rend="ital">the river Medus</hi>, a small branch of the Araxes, mentioned by Strabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28301.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mhdi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a country lying between Armenia, Parthia, Hyrcania, and Assyria</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Azerbijan, Shirvan, Ghilan</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">Mazanderan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 29, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28301.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Median, Assyrian, Persian</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>Persian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <trans><tr>the orange-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>: mala, <hi rend="ital">Assyrian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">oranges, citrons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 14, 14, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Nemesis, a statue of Parian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 54</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Mē-dĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the emperor Verus, on account of his victory over the Medes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Verr. 7</bibl>; v. Medica.</sense></entryFree>
medialis: <entryFree id="n28302" type="main" key="me^di^a_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n28302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">middle; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the middle</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28303" type="gloss" key="me^di^a_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: medialem appellabant hostiam atram, quam meridie immolabant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.; cf. meridies <sense id="n28303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mediamna: <entryFree id="n28304" type="main" key="Me^di^amna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭamna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>medius-amnis</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mesopotami/a</foreign>, <sense id="n28304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Mesopotamia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1097</bibl> P. <cb n="MEDI" /></sense></entryFree>
medians: <entryFree id="n28305" type="main" key="me^di^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. medio.</entryFree>
medianus: <entryFree id="n28306" type="main" key="me^di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n28306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is in the middle, middle</hi> (except Vitr., only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acroteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita leonina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 73, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 463, 95</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the middle part, the middle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex mediano coenaculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5, § 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediana malvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2:133" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2, 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mediastinus: <entryFree id="n28307" type="main" key="me^di^asti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭastīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a common servant, drudge</hi>, employed in all kinds of menial occupations (class.): tu illi mediastinus, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque bubulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus collectus ex senibus desperatis, ex agresti luxuria, ex rusticis mediastinis, decoctoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu mediastinus tacitā prece rura petebas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:3" default="NO">1, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prodicus instituens quam vocant iatralepticen, reunctoribus quoque medicorum, ac mediastinis vectigal invenit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>medical assistants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mediatenus: <entryFree id="n28308" type="main" key="me^di^a_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭātĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>mediā tenus, like hactenus</etym>, <sense id="n28308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as far as the middle, half way over</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 683</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, § 873</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mediator: <entryFree id="n28309" type="main" key="me^di^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n28309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mediator</hi> (post-class., esp. in eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tot mediatorum praesentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 36, p. 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediator unius non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediator advenit, id est Deus in carne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Resurr. 51 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:42:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 42, 2 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
mediatrix: <entryFree id="n28310" type="main" key="me^di^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭātrix</orth>, <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mediator</etym>, <sense id="n28310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mediatrix</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 5, 565</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medibile: <entryFree id="n28311" type="gloss" key="me^di^bi^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭbĭle</orth>, <itype>medicabile</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123:21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123, 21</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
medica: <entryFree id="n28312" type="main" key="Me_di^ca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mhdikh/</foreign> [Media], <sense id="n28312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excellent kind of clover introduced from Media; Burgundy-clover, lucern</hi> (Medicago sativa), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28313" type="main" key="me^di^ca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n28313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female physician;</hi> v 1. medicus, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
medicabilis: <entryFree id="n28314" type="main" key="me^di^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medicor</etym>. <sense id="n28314.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., that can be healed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cured, curable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullis amor est medicabilis herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 523</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:416" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 416</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28314.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., healing, curative, medicinal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>soothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:87" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 87</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕ-dĭcābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">medicinally</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 31, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medicabulum: <entryFree id="n28315" type="main" key="me^di^ca_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a healthy place</hi> (post-class.): aegris medicabula, App <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:page=353:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> p. 353, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medicamen: <entryFree id="n28316" type="main" key="me^di^ca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drug, medicament</hi>, in a good and a bad sense, meaning both <hi rend="ital">a healing substance, remedy, medicine</hi>, and, as also medicamentum and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a poisonous drug, poison</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; only once in Cic.; cf., on the contrary, medicamentum). </sense><sense id="n28316.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy, antidote, medicine</hi>: violentis medicaminibus curari, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestia medicamina adhibent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies medicaminibus interstincta,</quote> <trans><tr>plasters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamen habendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:254" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicaminis datio vel impositio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 23, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia materni medicaminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum (ejus) medicamina possunt quae steriles facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:595" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 595</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28316.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy, antidote</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">iratae medica mina fortia praebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:489 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 489 sq.</bibl></cit>. quasso medicamina Imperio circumspectare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28316.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28316.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A poisonous drug, poison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infusum delectabili cibo boletorum venenum, nec vim medicaminis statim mtellectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:20:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28316.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A coloring-matter, tincture, dye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">croceum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 238</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28316.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a paint, wash, cosmetic</hi>: est mihi, quo dixi vestrae medicamina formae, Parvus, sed cura grande libellus opus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the treatise</hi> Medicamina faciei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 205</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies medicamine attrita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28316.7" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an artificial means of improving a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (caseus) exiguum medicaminis habet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rennet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosum, i. e. conditura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina medicamine instaurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>manure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 22, § 99</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1123" /> <cb n="MEDI" /></sense></entryFree>
medicamentarius: <entryFree id="n28317" type="main" key="me^di^ca_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medicamentum</etym>, <sense id="n28317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to drugs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to poisons;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28317.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcāmen-tārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28317.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A druggist, apothecary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 33, § 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28317.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A preparer of poisons</hi>: homicida vel medicamentarius, Cod. Th. 3, 16, 1.—</sense><sense id="n28317.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcāmentā-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female mixer of poisons</hi>: moecha vel medicamentaria, Cod. Th. 3, 16, 1.— </sense><sense id="n28317.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The art of preparing drugs, pharmacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentaria a Chirone (reperta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medicamentosus: <entryFree id="n28318" type="main" key="me^di^ca_mento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcāmentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a healing power, medicinal</hi> (perh. only <foreign lang="greek">a(/pac ei)rhm</foreign>.; in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 2</bibl> dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. medicamento): aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medicamentum: <entryFree id="n28319" type="main" key="me^di^ca_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>medicor</etym>, <sense id="n28319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drug, remedy, physic, medicine, medicament</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28319.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum alicui dare ad aquam intercutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <trans><tr>to compound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 34, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta salubria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 132</bibl></cit>.—Also of remedies applied externally: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentis delibutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a drug, a potion</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28319.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hurtful drug, poison</hi>: quaerit ibidem ab Hannibale, cur biberit medicamentum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 345, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquere medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentis partum abigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamento sagittas tingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 76, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatorium,</quote> <trans><tr>a love-potion, philter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">an enchanted potion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tincture for dyeing, a color, dye, mordant</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 521, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 26, § 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A seasoning, condiment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A paint, wash, cosmetic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A plastering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28319.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A remedy, relief, antidote</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multorum medicamentum laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:71:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 71, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris medicamenta illa Epicurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panchrestum medicamentum (sc. pecunia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:65:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 65, § 152</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.10" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">An embellishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta fucati candoris, et ruboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28319.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An enchantment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid mali medicamenti inferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medicatio: <entryFree id="n28320" type="hapax" key="me^di^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, lit., <sense id="n28320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a healing, cure;</hi> hence, in agriculture, <hi rend="ital">a besprinkling with vegetable juices</hi>, e. g., of lentils, to preserve them from the corn-worm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medicator: <entryFree id="n28321" type="main" key="me^di^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a physician</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">annunciari Christum medicatorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 216</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medicatus: <entryFree id="n28322" type="main" key="me^di^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. medico.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28323" type="main" key="me^di^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>medicor</etym>, <sense id="n28323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charm</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medicina: <entryFree id="n28324" type="main" key="me^di^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. medicinus, II.</entryFree>
medicinalis: <entryFree id="n28325" type="main" key="me^di^ci_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medicina</etym>, <sense id="n28325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to medicine, medical, medicinal</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ars, Cels. praef.: cucurbitulae,</quote> <trans><tr>cupping-glasses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 43, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Compos. 53" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Compos. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus,</quote> <trans><tr>the next to the little finger</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medicinus: <entryFree id="n28326" type="main" key="me^di^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. medicus</etym>, <sense id="n28326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a physician</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surgeon, medical</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> only ante- and post-class.; as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> class.). </sense><sense id="n28326.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the healing art, medicine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 93</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 274" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28326.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28326.3" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. ars.) <hi rend="ital">The healing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">medical art, medicine, surgery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut medicina (ars est) valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina, quae ex observatione salubrium atque his contrariorum reperta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: tertiam esse partem medicinae, quae manu curet, i. e. <hi rend="ital">surgery</hi>, Cels. prooem. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinam excolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to practise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarus medicinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28326.4" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. officina.) <hi rend="ital">The shop of a physician</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surgeon;</hi> the booth in which a physician waited on his patients and vended his medicines (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): in medicinis, in tonstrinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: veteres absolute dicebant pistrinam et sutrinam et medicinam, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4</bibl>, <cb n="MEDI" /> 2, 45 (the taberna of the physician is mentioned in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 6, § 12</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n28326.5" n="C" level="2"> (Sc. res.) <hi rend="ital">A remedy, medicine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28326.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si medicus veniat, qui huic morbo facere medicinam potest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>heal, cure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere medicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28326.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n28326.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Like medicamentum, <hi rend="ital">poison</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 20, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 579 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n28326.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The pruning</hi> of vines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28326.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy, relief, antidote</hi> (a favorite word of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">singulis medicinam consilii atque orationis meae afferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non egeo medicinā: me ipse consolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublevatio et medicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sanaret vitiosas partes rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crede mihi, non ulla tua'st medicina figurae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>no means of rendering beautiful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:23:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 23, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">his quatuor causis totidem medicinae opponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 339</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medico: <entryFree id="n28327" type="main" key="me^di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. medicus</etym>, <sense id="n28327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heal, cure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for the class. medeor). </sense><sense id="n28327.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28327.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istum lepide medicabo metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) odore galbani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneris aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:98" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28327.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulis membris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 48, 902</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28327.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28327.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To impart the virtue of a remedy, give healing power to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc fusum labris splendentibus amnem Inficit, occulte medicans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 418</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28327.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To besprinkle with the juice of herbs, to medicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <trans><tr>to steep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina omnia suco herbae quae sedum appellatur, medicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:30:40" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 30, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigua portione medicatur aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:3" default="NO">9, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum medicatum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spurious, adulterated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 51, § 118</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n28327.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To color, dye</hi>, with tingere: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28327.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Besprinkled with juices, sprinkled, medicated</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">semina suco herbae sedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <trans><tr>places sprinkled with the juice of herbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: somnus, <hi rend="ital">produced by a juice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a charm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana medicata fuco,</quote> <trans><tr>stained, dyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amyclaeis medicatum vellus ahenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 707</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To poison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boletum medicatum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>poisoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medicata veneno tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicatae cuspidis ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui,</quote> <trans><tr>embalmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28327.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Useful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">good for healing, medicinal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae medicatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inguen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac bubulum medicatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 124</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res medicatissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medicor: <entryFree id="n28328" type="main" key="me^di^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n28328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to heal, cure</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28328.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n28328.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senibus medicantur anhelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28328.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspidis ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 756</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28328.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cure, relieve</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ego possim in hac re medicari mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istum lepide medicabor metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit> Weise (Lorenz, medicabo).</sense></entryFree>
medicosus: <entryFree id="n28329" type="main" key="me^di^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">healing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fomentationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medicus: <entryFree id="n28330" type="main" key="me^di^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>medeor</etym>, <sense id="n28330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to healing, healing, curative, medical</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n28330.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicas adhibere manus ad vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 69, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 16, 15, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 81, § 163</bibl></cit>: digitus, <hi rend="ital">the next to the little finger</hi> (cf. medicinalis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 12, 34, § 108</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n28330.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">magical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marmaridae, medicum vulgus, ad quorum tactum mites jacuere cerastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:300" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 300</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28330.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n28330.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28330.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A medical man, physician, surgeon</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicus nobilissimus atque optimus quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicum arcessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admovere aegro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerum,</quote> <trans><tr>a surgeon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>: caeduntur<cb n="MEDI" />  tumidae medico ridente mariscae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus ait se obligasse crus fractum Aesculapio, Apollini autem bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MEDICVS CLINICVS, CHIRVRGVS, OCVLARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2983</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AVRICVLARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">IVMENTARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4229</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medici pecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">LEGIONIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 448</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4996</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DVPLARIVS TRIREMIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum medici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 62</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">medice, cura teipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28330.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The finger next the little finger</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">da/ktulos i)atriko/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 20, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28330.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭ-ca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female physician</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 363</bibl> Oud.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4230 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 635, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">636, 1</bibl> sq.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a midwife</hi>, Interpr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28330.8" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">medicinal herbs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28331" type="main" key="Me_di^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Medi, II. B.</entryFree>
medidies: <entryFree id="n28332" type="main" key="me^di_dies"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdīdies</orth>, v. meridies.</entryFree>
medie: <entryFree id="n28333" type="main" key="me^di^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. medius <sense id="n28333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
medietas: <entryFree id="n28334" type="main" key="me^di^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n28334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the middle, place in the middle, midst</hi> (in Cic. only as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">meso/ths</foreign>; elsewhere postclass.). </sense><sense id="n28334.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vix audeo dicere medietates, quas Graeci <foreign lang="greek">meso/thtas</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic feliciore loco medietatis est positus (sc. homo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Asclep. 6, p. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediatate distinctis aquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Bapt. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28334.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a half, moiety</hi> (syn. dimidium): <cit><quote lang="la">decoquere aliquid usque ad medietatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 10</bibl></cit> and 30: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcum usque ad medietatem replere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mai. 3</bibl></cit>: debiti, Cod. Th. 4, 19, 1.—</sense><sense id="n28334.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a middle course, medium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medietatem quandam sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi medietates inter virtutes et vitia intercedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medilunius: <entryFree id="n28335" type="main" key="me^di^lu_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭlūnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mediusluna</etym>, <sense id="n28335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the middle of the month, having half a disk, half-orbed</hi> (post-class): <cit><quote lang="la">(luna) primo est corniculata, deinde medilunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 738</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medimnum: <entryFree id="n28336" type="greek" key="me^dimnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdimnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdim-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/dimnos</foreign>, a Greek measure of corn, <sense id="n28336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek bushel</hi> (containing six modii): primus, secundus, tertius medimnus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 213, 21</bibl>; so in <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medimnum tritici seritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quot jugera sunt sata, totidem medimna decumae debeantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>, § 113; in <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medimnūm,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 37</bibl>, § 84; 2, 3, 39, § 90; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 495, 32</bibl> (cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 107).</sense></entryFree>
medio: <entryFree id="n28337" type="main" key="me^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n28337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to halve, divide in the middle</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 3, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28337.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be in the middle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius Juno mediante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mediocriculus: <entryFree id="n28338" type="hapax" key="me^di^o_^cri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭō^crĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [mediocris], <hi rend="ital">rather middling</hi>: exercitus, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=154" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 154</bibl>, and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=155" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 155</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
mediocris: <entryFree id="n28339" type="main" key="me^di^o_^cris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭō^cris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (ō usually; rarely ŏ), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n28339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a middle state</hi> between too much and too little, <hi rend="ital">middling, moderate, tolerable, ordinary;</hi> sometimes also, <hi rend="ital">not remarkable, indifferent, mediocre</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28339.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.). </sense><sense id="n28339.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of size, quantity, degree, etc., in material things: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Alex. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28339.3" n="B" level="2"> Of mind, character, ability, acts, achievements, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">C. L. Memmii fuerunt oratores mediocres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cotta in mediocrium oratorum numero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocres viri, sed maximi et docti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediocribus vel studiis vel officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusare ... mediocris est animi,</quote> <trans><tr>narrow, small</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mediocris jacturae te mergat onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28339.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n28339.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Per litoten</hi>, with non (haud, nec), <hi rend="ital">not insignificant, not common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trivial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurthae non mediocrem animum pollicitando accendebant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ardent, ambitious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocris hominis haec sunt officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mediocris hic, ut ego quidem intellego, vir fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 55</bibl></cit>: nec mediocre<pb n="1124" /> <cb n="MEDI" />  telum ad res gerendas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocrem sibi diligentiam adhibendam intellegebat,</quote> <trans><tr>uncommon, extraordinary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
