G. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium non mediocre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocris dissensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—*</sense><sense id="n28339.6" n="B" level="2"> With syllaba, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> = anceps: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum longarum et brevium et mediocrium junctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:18:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭō^crĭ-ter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n28339.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Moderately, tolerably, ordinarily, not particularly, not very, not remarkably, not much</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ordo annalium mediocriter nos retinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus mediocriter aegrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28339.8" n="(b)" level="5"> By litotes, with <hi rend="ital">haud, ne, non</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supra, mediocris, II. A.): flagitium, et damnum haud mediocriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocriter,</quote> <trans><tr>in no moderate degree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensus est non mediocriter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>greatly, exceedingly, very much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:57 al" default="NO">11, 1, 57 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n28339.9" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Very little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mediocriter quidem disertus,</quote> <trans><tr>not in the least</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28339.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With moderation, calmly, tranquilly</hi> = modice (rare, and perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi non mediocriter ferendum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 95</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vellem mediocrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mediocritas: <entryFree id="n28340" type="main" key="me^di^o_^cri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭō^crĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mediocris</etym>. <sense id="n28340.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A middle state, a medium, mean; moderateness, moderation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritatem illam tenere, quae est inter nimium et parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo,</quote> <trans><tr>mediocrity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 66, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a medium between excessive gayety and over-seriousness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auream quisquis mediocritatem Diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>. —Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis virtus sit mediocritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 40, 149</bibl></cit>: mediocritatis (exemplum esse) Terentium, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 14, 6</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritates illi probabant,</quote> <trans><tr>moderate passions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritates vel perturbationum vel morborum animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28340.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Meanness, insignificance, littleness, inferiority</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod meae mediocritati conveniret,</quote> <trans><tr>my insignificance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritas nostra,</quote> <trans><tr>my modest self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:111:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 111, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mediocriter: <entryFree id="n28341" type="main" key="me^di^o_^cri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭō^crĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mediocris <sense id="n28341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mediolanum: <entryFree id="n28342" type="main" key="Me^di^o_la_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭōlānum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭōlānĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n28342.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">the capital of the Insubres</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Milan</hi>. Form Mediolanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> de Clar. Urb. 4, 1</bibl>. Form Mediolanium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 46, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 20</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28342.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭōlā-nensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Milan, Milanese</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ager),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭōlānen-ses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Milanese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28342.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The chief city of the Santoni in Gaul, on the river Carantonus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Saintes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 12</bibl>; Itin. Anton. p. 459, 3.</sense></entryFree>
mediomatrici: <entryFree id="n28343" type="main" key="Me^di^o_ma_tri^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭōmātrĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul, on the Moselle, in the neighborhood of Metz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭ-ōmātrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 731, 12</bibl>; and in <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3523</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medion: <entryFree id="n28344" type="greek" key="me_di^on1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n28344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicinal plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 79, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28345" type="main" key="Me^di^on2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Acarnania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 23, 3</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Medion.—Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕ-dĭōnii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Medion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medioxime: <entryFree id="n28346" type="main" key="me^di^oxi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭoxĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭoxŭmē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. medioximus <sense id="n28346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
medioximus: <entryFree id="n28347" type="main" key="me^di^oxi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭoxĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭoxŭmus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>superlative of an obsolete mediox for medius</etym>. <sense id="n28347.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In the middle, middlemost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio actum modo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 141, 4</bibl></cit>: medioximus, <foreign lang="greek">me/sos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medioxumam quam duxit uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di deaeque superi atque inferi et medioxumi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>holding a middle place between the supernal and infernal deities</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: tertium habent (deorum genus), quos medioximos Romani veteres appellant, quod et sui ratione et loco et potestate diis summis sunt minores, hominum natura<cb n="MEDI" />  profecto majores, <hi rend="ital">between gods and men</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam aras superiorum deorum volunt esse, medioxumorum, id est marinorum, focos, inferorum mundos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sea-gods, between those of heaven and those of Hades</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 134</bibl></cit>.—Of tutelar deities: hos omnes Graeci <foreign lang="greek">dai/monas</foreign> dicunt, <foreign lang="greek">a)po\ tou= dah/monas ei)=nai</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini medioximos vocitarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28347.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Middling, moderate</hi>: medioximum mediocre, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.—Hence, *<pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭ-oxĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭoxŭmē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">moderately, tolerably</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 141, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medipontus: <entryFree id="n28348" type="main" key="medipontus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">medipontus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thick rope</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medipontos privos loreos (al. melipontos),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meditabundus: <entryFree id="n28349" type="main" key="me^di^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>meditor</etym>, <sense id="n28349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">earnestly meditating, designing;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Romanum meditabundus bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meditamen: <entryFree id="n28350" type="main" key="me^di^ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinking of</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a preparation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">meditamina belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:326" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meditamentum: <entryFree id="n28351" type="main" key="me^di^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinking of</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a preparation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28351.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietum meditamenta,</quote> <trans><tr>thoughtfully prepared battering-rams</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.— *</sense><sense id="n28351.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.; <number>plur.</number>: puerilia, <hi rend="ital">rudiments</hi> taught to children at school, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 8, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
meditate: <entryFree id="n28352" type="main" key="me^di^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. meditor <sense id="n28352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
meditatio: <entryFree id="n28353" type="main" key="me^di^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>meditor</etym>, <sense id="n28353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinking over</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">contemplation, meditation</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28353.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">stultam esse meditationem futuri mali, aut fortasse ne futuri quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 32</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n28353.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28353.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Preparation</hi> for any thing (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa commentatio atque meditatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 118</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">obeundi sui muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditatio atque exercitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla meditationis suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 37, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 54:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:13:35" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetoricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28353.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">exercise, practice</hi> in any thing, <hi rend="ital">custom, habit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum edomari meditatione curvandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 19, 30, § 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meditatiuncula: <entryFree id="n28354" type="main" key="me^di^ta_ti^uncu^la_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātĭuncŭlā</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of meditatio</etym>, <sense id="n28354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trifling preparation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> de Stat. Anim. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meditativus: <entryFree id="n28355" type="main" key="me^di^ta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>meditor</etym>, <sense id="n28355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">meditative</hi> (post-class.): meditativa verba, <hi rend="ital">which signify a desire to perform an action</hi>, also called desiderativa (as lecturio, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 336</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 825</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
meditator: <entryFree id="n28356" type="main" key="me^di^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who thinks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plans, a meditator</hi> (post-class.): meditator (al. meditatus), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 265.</sense></entryFree>
meditatorium: <entryFree id="n28357" type="main" key="me^di^ta_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>meditator</etym>. <sense id="n28357.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preparation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">meditatorium Evangelii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28357.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place of preparation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jovin. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meditatus: <entryFree id="n28358" type="main" key="me^di^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from meditor, q. v.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28359" type="main" key="me^di^ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>meditor</etym>, <sense id="n28359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinking, meditating upon</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a meditation</hi>, i. q. meditatio (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mediterraneus: <entryFree id="n28360" type="main" key="me^di^terra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭ-terrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mediusterra</etym>, <sense id="n28360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">midland, inland, remote from the sea, mediterranean</hi> (opp. to maritimus). </sense><sense id="n28360.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nascitur ibi plumbum album in mediterraneis regionibus, in maritimis ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus (opp. maritimus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines maxime mediterranei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Enna mediterranea est maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">191: commercium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28360.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in late Lat.: Mediterraneum mare, <hi rend="ital">the Mediterranean Sea</hi>, for Mare magnum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28360.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭterrānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the interior</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in mediterraneo est Segeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭterrānĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inland parts, interior</hi> of a country: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediterraneis Hispaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 51, § 158</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mediterreus: <entryFree id="n28361" type="gloss" key="me^di^terre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭterrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inland, remote from the sea</hi>, another form of the preceding word: mediterream melius quam <cb n="MEDI" /> mediterraneam Sisenna dici putat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123:22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123, 22</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
meditor: <entryFree id="n28362" type="main" key="me^di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n28362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. madh-a, wisdom; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/qos, manqa/nw, mh/domai</foreign>; cf.: medeor, re-med-ium, etc.</etym>; <hi rend="ital">act., to think</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reflect upon, to muse over, consider, meditate upon; neutr., to think, reflect, muse, consider, meditate; to design, purpose, intend</hi>, etc.; constr. with <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ad, de</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28362.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28362.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semulque cursuram meditabor ad ludos Olympios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea para, meditare, cogita, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aliud cogitare, meditari, curare nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum, subsellia, rostra curiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam ad legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor tuum meditabitur timorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>promote by meditation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 33, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28362.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad;</hi> ne ad eam rem meditere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hujus vitae studium meditati illi sunt qui feruntur labores tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28362.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de tua ratione meditere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28362.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 107</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam designatus alio incessu esse meditabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos annos regnare meditatus magno labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animo meditaretur proficisci in Persas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea nunc meditabor quo modo illi dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditabor, quo modo cum illo loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid contra dicerem, mecum ipse meditabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditare, quibus verbis incensam illius cupiditatem comprimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis modis meditatus egomet mecum sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressus ad meditandum in agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 63</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n28362.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to meditate, study, exercise one's self in, practise</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nugas est meditatus male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes perfecit meditando, ut nemo planius esse locutus putaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes in litore meditans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Crassus ageret meditandi aut discendi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut in foro dicere aut meditari extra forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:302" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 88, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 112</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi editos partus exercent cursu, et fugam meditari docent,</quote> <trans><tr>to practise flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 113</bibl></cit>.—Of things: semper cauda scorpionis in ictu est: nulloque momento meditari cessat, <hi rend="ital">to move as in readiness to strike</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 25, 30, § 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina meditantur aristas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 132</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">to murmur, utter a sad cry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamabo, meditabor ut columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 38, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">59, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28362.7" n="III" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif. (in <hi rend="ital">verb. fin.</hi> post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">adulteria meditantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 25, 1</bibl></cit>.—But freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtā-tus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n28362.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exercised, practised, instructed</hi> (only Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">cumque huc ad adulescentem meditatum probe mittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probe meditatam utramque duco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:539" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 539</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28362.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Thought upon, meditated, weighed, considered, studied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditati sunt doli docte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae meditata et praeparata inferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditatum et cogitatum scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditatum cogitatumque verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accuratae et meditatae commentationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: meditata et composita oratio (opp. <hi rend="ital">extemporized</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 84</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a carefully prepared speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive meditata sive subita proferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtfully, designedly, intentionally</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu illorum mores perquam meditate tenes,</quote> <trans><tr>knowest thoroughly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hau male meditate male dicax es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effundere probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meditrina: <entryFree id="n28363" type="gloss" key="Me^di^tri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭtrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>medeor, with <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> suffix -tri-, as in nutrix, genetrix; v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 522</etym>, <sense id="n28363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of Healing;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
meditrinalia: <entryFree id="n28364" type="gloss" key="Me^di^tri_na_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdĭtrīnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Meditrina</etym>, <sense id="n28364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated on the</hi> 11<hi rend="ital">th of October in honor of Meditrina</hi> (on which occasion <pb n="1125" /> <cb n="MEDI" /> a libation of new wine was made for the first time): <cit><quote lang="la">Octobri mense Meditrinalia dies dictus a medendo, quod Flaccus flamen Martialis dicebat, hoc die solitum vinum novum et vetus libari et degustari medicamenti causā: quod facere solent etiam nunc multi cum dicant: Novum vetus vinum libo: novo veteri vino morbo medeor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 21</bibl></cit> Müll.: Meditrinalia dicta hac de causa. Mos erat Latinis populis, quo die quis primum gustaret mustum, dicere ominis gratiā: vetus novum vinum bibo, veteri novo morbo medeor. A quibus verbis etiam Meditrinae deae nomen conceptum ejusque sacra Meditrinalia dicta sunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123, 15</bibl> Müll.; v. also Calend. Maff. et Amit. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 400</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meditullium: <entryFree id="n28365" type="main" key="me^di^tulli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭtullĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>medius and tollus, old form of tellus, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n28365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the middle</hi> (ante- and post-class.): in finitimo, legitimo, aeditimo non plus inesse timum, quam in meditullio, tullium, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso meditullio scenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio luci meditullio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 159: indifferentia ... nec bona nec mala sed velut in meditullio posita, Sen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, p. 191</bibl> (Fragm. 45 Haas); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Gal. 5, 19</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:32" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes in meditullio quodam virtutum sunt sitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medium: <entryFree id="n28366" type="main" key="me^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. medius, II.</entryFree>
medius: <entryFree id="n28367" type="main" key="me^di^us1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. madhya, the same; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/sos</foreign>; Angl. - Sax. midd; Germ. Mitte; cf. dimidius, meridies (medi-), etc.</etym>, <sense id="n28367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is in the middle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">midst, mid, middle</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28367.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28367.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra complexa medium mundi locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium mundi locum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus aeque prima, et media, et extrema pars attenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimum, proximum, medium tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro medio,</quote> <trans><tr>in the midst of the forum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medio foro,</quote> <trans><tr>in the open forum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solio medius consedit,</quote> <trans><tr>sat in the middle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:359" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 359</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">considit scopulo medius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilio medius sedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>in the meantime, meanwhile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: vinum novum, vetus, medium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">neither old nor new</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:31:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 31, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plenus fluctu medius foret alveus,</quote> <trans><tr>full to the middle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 30</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peloponnesii Megaram, mediam Corintho Athenisque urbem, condidere,</quote> <trans><tr>midway between Corinth and Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">si medius Polluce et Castore ponar,</quote> <trans><tr>between</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter bellum et pacem medium nihil sit,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no medium, no middle course between</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quos numeros duo medii inveniuntur (sc. numeri),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 737</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus medius regionum earum,</quote> <trans><tr>half-way between</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus medius juguli summique lacerti,</quote> <trans><tr>between</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 409</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 564</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et medius juvenum ibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medius silentūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:683" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 683</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medius ex tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium arripere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to seize one by the middle, around the body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem medium complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcides medium tenuit,</quote> <trans><tr>held him fast by the middle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium ostendere unguem,</quote> <trans><tr>to point with the middle finger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">half</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">hieme demunt cibum medium,</quote> <trans><tr>half their food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulum croci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 18</bibl></cit>: aurum ... Italicis totum, medium provincialibus reddidit, Capitol. Anton. Pius, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n28367.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of the middle, not very great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">small, middling, medial, moderate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28367.5" n="1" level="3"> Of age: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis mediae vir,</quote> <trans><tr>of middle age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.6" n="2" level="3"> Of plans, purposes, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil medium, nec spem nec curam, sed immensa omnia volventes animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium quiddam tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.7" n="3" level="3"> Of intellect: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiā medius,</quote> <trans><tr>middling, tolerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>moderate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Undetermined, undecided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios esse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>neutral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium se gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se dubium mediumque partibus praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:21:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum,</quote> <trans><tr>indefinite, ambiguous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 39</bibl></cit>: vocabula, <hi rend="ital">that can be taken in a</hi> <cb n="MEDI" /> <hi rend="ital">good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bad sense, ambiguous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 9, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28367.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Indifferent, not imperative</hi>: officium, <hi rend="ital">a duty which is not distinctly enjoined by the moral law, but is sustained by preponderant reasoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium officium id esse dicunt (Graeci) quod cur factum sit, ratio probabilis reddi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo intellegitur, officium medium quiddam esse, quod neque in bonis ponatur neque in contrariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sqq. and Madv. ad loc.: artes,</quote> <trans><tr>which in themselves are neither good nor bad, indifferent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.10" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Intermediate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium erat in Anco ingenium, et Numae et Romuli memor,</quote> <trans><tr>of a middle kind, resembling each in some degree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil habet ista res (actoris) medium, sed aut lacrimas meretur aut risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille jam paene medius adfectus est ex amoribus et desideriis amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who stands</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comes between, a mediator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium sese offert,</quote> <trans><tr>as a mediator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacator mediusque Syphax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:222" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis eras mediusque belli,</quote> <trans><tr>arbiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc mediis subeant irrita verba deis,</quote> <trans><tr>oaths in which the gods were called upon to be mediators</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 678</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.11" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Central</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex factione media consul,</quote> <trans><tr>fully committed to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (nearly = intimus), viros fortīs et magnanimos eosdem bonos et simplicīs ... esse volumus: quae sunt ex media laude justititiae,</quote> <trans><tr>these qualities are clearly among those which make uprightness praiseworthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partitiones oratoriae, quae e media illa nostra Academia effloruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:40:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 40, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressio e media philosophia repetita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio maerore et dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:29:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 29, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in media dimicatione,</quote> <trans><tr>the hottest of the fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio ardore certaminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in media solitudine,</quote> <trans><tr>the most profound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediis divitiis,</quote> <trans><tr>in abundant wealth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio robore virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio ardore belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in media reipublicae luce,</quote> <trans><tr>the full blaze of public life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">media inter pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:217" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 217</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense><sense id="n28367.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the middle, midst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28367.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28367.14" n="1" level="3"> Of space (very rare in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">in medio aedium sedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 45, 11</bibl></cit>; for which, without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, medio aedium eburneis sellis sedere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio viae ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agmine in primis modo, modo in postremis, saepe in medio adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl></cit>; for which, without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, medio sextam legionem constituit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio montium porrigitur planities,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio stans hostia ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio tutissimus ibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium geminos immani pondere caestus Projecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium sarcinas coniciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus consulem in medium acceptum, armis protegens, in castra reduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 46, 9</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam arbiter honorarius medium ferire voluisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut through the middle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intacta invidiā media sunt, ad summa ferme tendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.15" n="2" level="3"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>in the meantime, meanwhile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec longum in medio tempus, cum,</quote> <trans><tr>the interval</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 395</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28367.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The midst of all, the presence of all, the public, the community</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in medio omnibus palma est posita, qui artem tractant musicam,</quote> <trans><tr>lies open to all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae sunt in medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem totam in medio ponere,</quote> <trans><tr>publicly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">29: ponam in medio sententias philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi ratio in medio posita,</quote> <trans><tr>lies open to all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in medium proferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to publish, make known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: vocare in medium, <hi rend="ital">before the public, before a public tribunal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in medium vocare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio relinquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to leave it to the public, leave it undecided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 19, 16</bibl>: pellere e medio, <hi rend="ital">to expel, reject</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl> (Ann. v. 272 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jacentia verba sustulimus e medio,</quote> <trans><tr>adopt words from the people, common words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 177</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cb n="MEDU" /> munda sed e medio consuetaque verba puellae Scribite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 479</bibl>: tollere de medio, <hi rend="ital">to do away with, abolish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:71:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 71, § 176</bibl></cit>: tollere de medio, <hi rend="ital">to put out of the way, cut off, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de medio removere,</quote> <trans><tr>to put out of sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: e medio excedere or abire, <hi rend="ital">to leave the world, to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e medio excessit,</quote> <trans><tr>she is dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea mortem obiit, e medio abiit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollite lumen e medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 106</bibl></cit>: recedere de medio, <hi rend="ital">to go away, retire, withdraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur te mihi offers? recede de medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium venire or procedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to appear, come forward, show one's self in public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:71:section=175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 71, § 175</bibl></cit>: in medium, <hi rend="ital">before the public, for the public, for the community</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">communes utilitates in medium afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere in medium,</quote> <trans><tr>to care for the public good, for the good of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 335</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. separantem suas res a publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 14 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make acquisitions for the use of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 127</bibl></cit>: cedere, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devolve to the community</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre laudem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>so that all may have a share of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to communicate for the use of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium conferre, in gaming,</quote> <trans><tr>to put down, put in the pool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: in medio, for sub dio, <hi rend="ital">in the open air</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorpios fugari posse, si aliqui ex eis urantur in medio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A half</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">scillae medium conterunt cum aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobem ad medium completo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense><sense id="n28367.19" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the middle, in a middling degree, moderately, tolerably</hi> (except once in Tac. only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui noluerant medie,</quote> <trans><tr>kept quiet, remained neutral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec plane optimi, nec oppido deterrimi sunt, sed quasi medie morati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 22, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus medie humilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 20" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28367.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Indefinitely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, 17, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28368" type="main" key="me^di^us2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭus fĭdĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdĭusfĭdĭ-us</orth>, v. Fidius.</entryFree>
medix: <entryFree id="n28369" type="main" key="medix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">medix</orth>, v. meddix.</entryFree>
medixtuticus: <entryFree id="n28370" type="main" key="medixtuti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">medixtutĭcus</orth>, v. meddix.</entryFree>
medobrega: <entryFree id="n28371" type="main" key="Medobre_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Medobrēga</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Medubrīga, Mun-dobrīga</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Lusitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Portalegre</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 48, 4.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Medubrīgenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Medobrega</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 118</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">al. Medubricenses.—Also written ‡ MEIDVBRIGENSES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medon: <entryFree id="n28372" type="main" key="Me^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/dwn</foreign>. <sense id="n28372.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 303</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28372.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Codrus, king of Athens, the first archon;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdontĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">his descendants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28372.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Penelope's suitors; acc.</hi> Medonta, Sabin. Ep. 1, 47.</sense></entryFree>
medubrigenses: <entryFree id="n28373" type="main" key="Medubri_genses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Medubrīgenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Medobrega.</entryFree>
meduli: <entryFree id="n28374" type="main" key="Me^du^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Aquitanian Gaul, whose coast was famous for its oysters</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Medoc</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28374.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdŭlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdŭ-lĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Meduli, Medulian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28374.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdŭlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Medulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>oysters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medulla: <entryFree id="n28375" type="main" key="me^dulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>medius</etym>, <sense id="n28375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the marrow</hi> of bones; <hi rend="ital">the pith</hi> of plants (class.). </sense><sense id="n28375.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:37" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque albis ossa medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa regum vacuis exsucta medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per media foramina a cerebro medullā descendente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 67, § 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28375.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the pith, inside, kernel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis medullā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 42, § 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta, quae salsā aquā sparsa moluntur, candidiorem medullam reddunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>meal, flour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medulla ventris,</quote> <trans><tr>the inside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28375.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the marrow, kernel, innermost part, best part, quintessence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ego pereo, cui medullam lassitudo perbibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic fervor tamquam in venis medullisque insederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in medullis populi Romani ac visceribus haerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mihi semper erunt imis infixa medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi haeres in medullis,</quote> <trans><tr>who are at the bottom of my heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1126" /> <cb n="MEGA" /> qui mihi sunt inclusa medullis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum implevere medullas maturae mala nequitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:215" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communes loci, qui in mediis litium medullis versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>inner meaning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisio compagum ac medullarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the innermost parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: suadae, <hi rend="ital">the marrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quintessence of eloquence</hi>, said of Cethegus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl> (Ann. v. 309 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medullaris: <entryFree id="n28376" type="main" key="me^dulla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdullāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>medulla</etym>, <sense id="n28376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated in the marrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inmost part</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 193, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medullatus: <entryFree id="n28377" type="main" key="me^dulla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdullātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">possessed of marrow, marrowy;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">rich, fat, abounding in richness</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">convivium pinguium medullatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 25, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medulli: <entryFree id="n28378" type="main" key="Me^dulli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdulli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine people in</hi> Sabaudia, Inscr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 20</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28378.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdullīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Medulli, Medullian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medullini te feret aura noti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Alpine wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medullia: <entryFree id="n28379" type="main" key="Medulli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Medullĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Medullum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little town in Latium</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Monte Verde</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n28379.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Medullīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Medullia, Medullian;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28379.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdullīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> e. g. L. Furius Medullinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 25, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28379.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdullīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livia Medullina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:322" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 322</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Medullīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Medullia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 535</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medullinus: <entryFree id="n28380" type="main" key="Medulli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Medullīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n28380.0" n="I" level="1"> From Medulli.—</sense><sense id="n28380.1" n="II" level="1"> From Medullia.</sense></entryFree>
medullitus: <entryFree id="n28381" type="main" key="me^dulli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdullĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>medulla</etym>, <sense id="n28381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the marrow, to the very marrow, in the inmost part</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n28381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: medullitus aquiloniam intus servat frigedinem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inwardly, from the heart, thoroughly</hi>: qui mortalibus Versus propinas flammeos medullitus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 33, 7</bibl>, and 139, 14 (Sat. v. 7 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut videas eam medullitus me amare,</quote> <trans><tr>heartily, in one's inmost soul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendit sese jam mihi medullitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore commotus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 251</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medullo: <entryFree id="n28382" type="main" key="me^dullo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdullo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill with marrow</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cura nimia medullatos artus magni facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, 16, p. 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando ossa incipiunt medullari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Anim. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Anim. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; Ven. Carm. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
